author: RottieNut
title: Awesome! Except one thing...
content:
I love these headphones! They are nice at work to drown out the sounds of the cube farm. They hold a nice charge. I ordered these in January and, even with daily, cordless use with Bluetooth connected to my phone, I've only had to charge them three times! They are fairly light but I do move them around a bit during use or I get a sore spot on my head. The volume controls for the music are perfect. It's a bit weird to have a phone conversation with them on because it's hard to hear yourself talking to the person on the other end. They can hear me just fine I just have to be careful not to yell. I didn't purchase them for phone conversations so it's not a big deal.

So, they're near perfect. Why did I give them 4 stars? I had to knock down my rating from 5 stars to 4 because the voice prompts are obnoxiously loud! If I'm listening to my usual classical music and a call comes in on my cell phone (I'm obviously connected via Bluetooth) I nearly hit the ceiling because the voice prompt is so loud! When I turn the headphones on and off I put them over my leg and my coworkers a couple of cubicles away can hear the voice prompt. There is no way I can turn them on/off with the headphones on my ears.

They're great headphones, especially for the price, but I wish there was a way to turn the voice prompt down.

author: A. Landry
title: Just STUNNING!
content: From the outset, let me say that I am not a headphone person, although I do own a number of headphone and ear bud types ranging from fairly low cost ones to some costing a few hundred dollars.  I do use them from time to time, but always felt restricted by the cable and by the inevitable discomfort if I wore them for any length of time.  I have never owned a Bluetooth headphone frankly because of the expense and my overall dissatisfaction with earphones.  For the record, I am a mid-60 year old audio-aholic (someone who loves music to the extreme in all forms and types and formats) and over the past few years have returned to my analog roots - vinyl (played on my several turntables and cartridges), and cassettes (played on nice Nakamichi systems).  But I also have my pulse on the digital front too with a number of DAPs, iPods, FLAC-capable systems and the like.  Bottom line, I know my music from 50 years of playing it.  So tonight, after my Mpow 059 headphones arrived from Amazon, I charged them for a couple of hours on my MacBook, paired them and turned on my large New Age Mix.  That was three hours ago, and these phones are effortless and transparent!  I have to say that I am blown away that for less than $30 I received one of the best-sounding, highest quality, most capable headphones I have ever purchased.  They truly are remarkable!  Are they as good as my higher end phones?  I will leave that for now, but something tells me that if you try these out, you will not touch your more expensive wired headphones for awhile!  Just saying....

author: Damon L
title: Ideal headphones for most people
content: I bought these for my daughter.  I was  a bit hesitant with such a low price.  What a surprise!  I went for a walk and used them.  Excellent passive noise reduction.  The sound, we'll balanced.  I am a Bose fan, and that's the nearest I can compare to as far as balance.  The do not feel like a $30 set of headphones, very solid build.  I am going to order my own.  Currently I have the Quitecomfort - I believe 25 - not blue tooth.  If Bose is an A+, these would be a B+ to A-.  I think the passive noise reduction is actually better in these.  But when you factor in $30 - they are a better deal than the Bose and any other popular brand.  The only folks I would not recommend these too are heavy base loving folks and sound snobs for lack of better word.  The folks where it has to be perfect sound - they wouldn't even consider it.  For most folks, these are ideal.  The best return for the value.

author: Ammy Woodbury
title: Really good for the price
content: I looked at everything from these to top of the line Sony and Bose. What's great about these headphones is that they do a decent job (far better than the Plantronics I spent too much on!) and I don't worry they'll be stolen off my desk. And if they are, meh, I'll spend another $30 and get another pair. Seriously, that peace of mind is worth a lot. They pair gracefully with phone and computer, worked well for a Zoom meeting, worked well for listening to the KQED stream, my music library, and Spotify, and block out enough ambient noise to let me focus on my work. Plus, with Bluetooth, I can run to the bathroom when I need to without having them accidentally ripped off my head when I forget they're there. I got a deal and I think they were really only $28. For that price, I should've bought two. If they last five months, I'm winning. Totally competent, comfy to wear all day, and not so expensive you fret about them. For me, that's solid gold.

author: Cayton Keller
title: Loved them until recently
content: I got these headphones at the end of May in 2018. I use them twice a month for a live seminar I am required to attend via computer. This seminar didn't start until July and its April 1st, so you think they have been used literally 18 times. Well when I went to use them for my seminar last week, they have shorted out. :( The only way that they work and actually produce sound is if they are plugged up to the charger during use which totally defeats the purpose of blue tooth right? They have not been banged around or misused so there is absolutely no reason this should have happened, especially with such little use. Also, I have tried multiple charges and it makes no difference. The headphones just crapped out on me which sucks because they were so comfortable and produced great sound. I was going to put these in my kids Easter baskets but now I am unsure what to do.

author: K&L
title: Awesome set of cans!
content:
UPDATE #1
13 months after purchase, the headband cracked. Mpow had a replacement to me within the week, free of charge. I can't say enough good things about their customer service or their product. They have a lifetime customer in me.

************

I love these headphones. The ear cups are super comfortable! No active noise cancelling; but with the over the ear model, it wasn't needed. I wear them everywhere! Doing yardwork, in the office to tune out loud colleagues, plane trips to block out sound, and everywhere in between. Couldn't ask for a better set! The only downside is I only ordered one pair for me. The kids can't wait for me to walk in the door from work. I would like to think it's cause they're excited to see me, but they just want to steal my headphones.

author: Wheelguner
title: Very comfortable
content: I want to point out that the rating I gave for battery is due to lack of time spent using them. I was going to wait until I had more time with them before posting a review. I received an email from the vendor (which is not always done) asking if I had received the headphones and if I had any issues with them. The email included a link and asked for a review and her I am. The headphones appear to be very well made of excellent materials. The instructions, although tiny as is common today, were adequate and  they paired to my Pixel II flawlessly. It was a bit more involved to pair with my laptop but that is Win10 and no fault of MPOW's. So far I am very satisfied and would recommend them. I will update this review after using long enough to accurately comment on battery life. 08MAY2019 Update on battery as promised. Using them as I normally do, I have not depleted the battery and occasionally charge them just to be on the safe side.

author: Robert Russell
title: Great Sound for Budget Headphones
content:
I've really enjoyed these MPow Bluetooth Headphones, especially for the price.  At an entry level price, you get good sound and long battery life.  It doesn't have the really deep bass like some other headphones do, but they offer decent balanced sound.  If you wear them for more than an hour, it could start to hurt your ears if you have larger ears.  If you use the bluetooth feature, make sure you either turn your headphones or phone volume all the way up to maximize your volume.  With one turned all the way up then you can control the volume with the other device.

They pair really fast with an iPhone 6S Plus and they have audio cues to let you know what mode the headphones are in.

Making a call was clear, but having my voice muffled by the over-the-ear style headphones isn't ideal for me, so I probably wouldn't use them for long calls.

While they don't have active noise cancellation, they do a good job at keeping background noise out because of the style.

author: chris
title: Good headphones especially for the price.
content: I had the older style before. Bluetooth on these is way better then the old pair you can actually walk 20-30 feet from the device even with a wall I'm between, where the old model had trouble if I put my phone in my pocket. Sound is similar to the old pair it's pretty good but not amazing sounding. I like the headphone controls they are more intuitive then most I have seen, although you do hear it pretty loudly when you click a button with the headphones on. One con that I noticed is that if you use these while working out your ears will get pretty sweaty. Update. I've had these over a year now, and I am really impressed with these headphones. I actually changed it from 4 to 5 stars, I stand by everything I said before, and if I were to add anything I would say they aren't very noise isolating, but overall I have been very satisfied with their performance and battery life.

author: SDite
title: Stopped working....Mpow replaced them
content:
It was great until the left side stopped working after just 6 months. Before I was going to throw them in the trash, I wanted to try and fix them. Unfortunately, they're sealed and can't be taken apart. So I just hit it with my fist a couple of times. VOILA!!! The left channel started to work again. I'm assuming the left channel will go out again, sooner than later....

UPDATE: Mpow contacted me and replaced the headphones. So far the new ones sound fine. GREAT customer service!!! It's nice to work with a professional company that stands by their products.

author: Sam
title: Very nice headphones!
content: These headphones are quite nice.  They fit well and operate as stated.  I purchased them to operate with my 55 series Samsung TV.  The 55 series will not sync directly to the headphones (the 64 series will) so I purchased a Bluetooth adaptor which synced with the headphones easily.  These headphones support two Bluetooth devices allowing me to sync my iPhone as a secondary device.  I couldn't be happier with the outcome and yes, I would recommend to friends and family.

author: Blue w126
title: Had issues with headphones but seller went out of their way to fix the problem
content:
My initial review of this product included my frustration with the headphones randomly disconnecting and then having problems reconnecting mostly to my laptop.  Other than this, I really liked these headphones.  They are comfortable, I can hear the sounds clearly, and they hold a charge for a long time.  I am in the habit to charging them once a week but I really do not have to.  They really last for a long time and I use them everyday. They are also sturdy but fold up nicely for storage.
Honestly, they are great headphones especially given the price point. I cannot imagine how more expensive headphones could be any better.
Still, the random disconnecting was a major frustration.  After posting my initial review, the seller contacted my to let me know they had sent out new headphones since mine were malfunctioning.  I had not asked for anything so I was surprised.
That set did not arrive.  I assume that they were delivered to my old house.  When the seller  contacted me again to see if the new headphones were okay, I thanked them but let them know that it is likely that the person who bought my old house received a pleasant surprise.  I figured that would be the end of it.  The seller emailed me that they would send another set of headphones out to the correct address.
They did just that.  I have to say that I was not expecting the customer service that I received.  I have to give them a big plus on this.  I feel that they really went out of their way to fix the issue I was having.

author: Mr. Chiavare
title: **UPDATED REVIEW** Inexpensive headphones, good for movie watching...
content:
**UPDATED REVIEW**
I got a replacement pair of these. The sound quality is better, but still don't work for my conference calls. The sound is "tin" like and I sound very far away from the mic in my tests, as if I am yelling across a table to be heard.

For movie watching/music listening, these are fine. They fold, becoming more compact, and have a carrying pouch. Again, better sound than my original pair, but not amazing.

I currently use a Corsair headset, and the sound is amazing both for conference calls and while music/movie listening.

**ORIGINAL REVIEW**
I use these for audio calls on my laptop (for conference calls) as well as listening to movies on my tablet. As far as sound quality for listening to movies, they are fine but not stellar. They don't have a great range for sound quality and often loud but not clear; there is not a subtleness to the sounds.
When I am on conference calls, people often say they are unable to hear me and the sound quality is muffled.
I would not buy this product or from this company again.

author: prjc18
title: Pretty good for the price.
content:
Try to write a quick honest review here.
I’ve had these for about a week now. I work outside half the week doing mowing and other things as a building manager. I wanted something that would last all day and muffle noise from the mower.
So let me say for the price these work great. Comfortable, look great and don’t fall out my ears like buds. The battery lasts me a 8 hour day easy so far. I’ve seen people huffing over having to charge them after a day but really what don’t you charge after a day of use? I like the functions and that I can move threw my songs without touching my phone. The range for me seems pretty good at least 20’ and the connections strong even with a mower running. The sound is to be expected for $37. I mean come on you didn’t expect them to be like beats,jbl,or bose did you? But for the price they pump pretty good and muffle outside sounds decently. I can hear my music very well with a motor right behind me so I’m pretty pleased. I can’t tell you the  Long Jevity of them yet but I hope they hold up.
For the record I only use these with my phone wirelessly so that’s what my experience is based on.
Just a quick update. Still great headphones but sadly already stopped charging. I’m a little disappointed as they are not that old and only used once a week at best. Bummer.

author: Jenne
title: The absolute BEST Bluetooth headphones, and at a great price too!
content:
I have a (just turned) 8 year old son, and we’ve had these for over a YEAR now. He uses them DAILY, and we’ve never had even ONE issue! As you can imagine, he’s a kid...He treats his possessions pretty well, but still...Daily use, for over an entire YEAR, and ZERO problems!?!? I would buy these again and again. The sound is so good...No kidding here, they rival my Beats! These are the absolute BEST bluetooth headphones especially for the price. Plus, green is his favorite color, and they match his iphone case perfectly!
He needed headphones for school this year, and I wanted to buy him the same ones, but just with a traditional cord, and without the Bluetooth feature, but unfortunately they only make a Bluetooth version (or if MPow does, I can’t find them)! and his school requires then to have a cord. I really hope they keep them exactly as they are, and don’t “update” them, because I will absolutely purchase another pair or two. They’re the best Bluetooth headphones on the market, imho. Highly recommend!

author: pappysproductions
title: Best Headphones
content: These headphones are perfect!

author: Matthew Romano
title: Stop shopping around, these are the ones you want.
content:
Outstanding headphones for a steal at $39.99. I own 3 different pair of wireless bluetooth headphones and these are by far my favorite. I bought these as an additional pair just to use at night in my bedroom. Kudos to the Amazon Firestick for having bluetooth capabilities as I got these specifically to avoid keeping my wife awake while I routinely stay up sfter she's sleeping watching one thing or another. They paired with no issues at all and have never dropped their connection. They are smart in the way of managing the battery life as I frequently just take them off and lay them on my night table without worrying about shutting them off. They have literally never run dead on me and I've gone days without charging them. When I do charge them I've never had an issue with one micro usb cable or another not charging them well... some devices dont charge well if you don't use the supplied cable - these don't seem to care at all what cord I use. They sound great and fit comfortably. The range is good as well... sometimes I'll get up to use the bathroom and they have never cut out. Sometimes I'll go downstairs and make a sandwich - still good to go at probably around 40-50 feet. Ive even stepped outside to the back deck for a smoke and occasionally it will start to cut out at that point... that's pretty understandable in my opinion. When that happens i just press the middle button on the left ear and it pauses whatever im watching.

My only negative is that sometimes I want to turn the volume very low. While using these the TV volume has no effect on the headphones, you only volume up or down using the buttons on the left ear. My only complaint is that the lowest they go before going to mute could be lower. It goes from moderately low to mute with one additiinal click. Thats pretty negligible to me when considering the overall capabilities of these headphones.

If youre looking for a great set for an even greater price, look no further.

author: 404UserNotFound
title: Decent pair of headphones for the price
content:
To be blunt, i'm not super happy with these headphones, the reviews make me think these were gana be great.
1. Maybe i have large ears, but they end up getting squished a tiny bit when i wear these, so over a long period of time, it hurts, but that may be just me. otherwise, it isn't too bad, fairly comfortable.
2. BLUETOOTH audio quality sucks. It works, and it plays music with no issues over long ranges, so A++, but the sound is tinny, and hollow, and there is static and crackles intermittently (and i'm sitting right next to my phone when it happens... not moving, nothing between phone and headphone)

Good news: the WIRED audio is fantastic. Sounds exactly as it should, no special audio tweaks required, and reproduction of all frequencies is on point. so, if you want a cheep pair of wired over-ear headphones these aren't bad! if you want high quality wireless audio, I don't think these are the ones for you.
I'll update this if i find a new place or situation where the wireless audio improves, but so far, i would not recommend. Sorry Mpow

author: C. D. Herter
title: Excellent value
content: You really can't go wrong with this headset for the price.  The sound, particularly the base, is very good.  I'm picky with headsets.  My Bose noise canceling ear buds are fantastic.  The Audio Techinc M50s are amazing, but this very inexpensive MPOW headphone is very good too...it's not as responsive on the high end, but really, for the price, it's absolutely wonderful.  I bought these primarily for my commute on the bus.  I wanted something not-too expensive, but decent enough to keep my happy for an hour.  Almost a year later, I'm still using these EVERY DAY, and they sound great!  I'm not really sure if the noise cancelling even works...I think most if from the isolation of the over-the-ear cushions, but the result is good for me. The bluetooth picks right up, never a problem with paring.  Both ear pads wore completely out, but weren't too hard to replace.  Some of the cosmetic details, like the plastic cover for the head band padding, came apart right away.  But I'm so impressed that the mechanical workings are rock solid, and I like the sound!  I got a great price on something that far exceeded my expectations, so I'm happy.

author: Christopher Riddick
title: Beyond worth it!
content: I waited to review this as I'm skeptical as most but I do take gambles every now and again. This paid off! My daily use in these have been for the gym. Even with all the sweat and cardio/weightlifting they do not slip off my head, which was my biggest concern. Sound is more than enough to drown out TV's, gym dance music plus your screamers! This also takes phone calls and no issues with people hearing you. I have also used the aux cable with my computer, also no issues i.e. crackling. This is an amazing headset for the price! If you want to spend another $200.00 for a higher end pair you can probably get a LITTLE lighter pair but these are not heavy to begin with. Ear are probably made for medium or small so if dumbo is your thing I would recommend something else. Hope this helps.

author: Reva M

content: So I bought these to use on my PC..they work well and connect without any trouble. Thing is when I use them for voice chatting people say that I sound far off or muffled. When I listen to music on youtube, the music sounds far off. author: matt lohkamp
title: mediocre headphones OR an adequate headset, can't be both.
content:
These headphones are comfortable enough to wear for an hour or two, but not much longer - and though the sound quality leaves *much* to be desired, you get what you pay for where audio gear is concerned. Bluetooth connectivity works with no trouble, and the option of pairing with multiple devices is appreciated. The microphone is sufficient for voice chatting (1ch 16bit 8000hz, aka Telephone Quality)

My main complaint with these headphones is the sound quality change that happens while you're using the mic. While using them as merely headphones, you can get readonably clear (2ch 16bit 44100hz, aka CD Quality) audio playback - the speakers themselves sound awfully tinny and weak, but at least the playback quality is acceptable. However, as soon as you activate the microphone, the quality drops significantly (to 1ch 16bit 8000hz, aka Telephone Quality, to match the microphone.) Imagine that instead of listening to your favorite track on a normal pair of headphones, you're listening to it through your phone speaker, transmitted from your friend who's holding their phone up to their laptop speakers - it's awful.

Honestly, you're better off spending more money on better gear, if you have the option - but if you don't, just know that you can either use this set as mediocre headphones, or an adequate headset for voice chat - never both at the same time. If you like to listen to music while your game and wan to still leave your mic active, you should look for a different product.

author: Wes
title: Budget-Friendly Headset for Calls and Media
content:
They have been ideal for use at the gym.  I consider them my “Leave me alone” headphones when I’m in public.  I’ve put these through mild to moderate use for the last few months.  They’re lightweight and feel inexpensive.  In hindsight, I wish that I had purchased a color other than red because now I realize they look like a pair of Beats knock-offs.  The sound quality is good, though you won’t get very deep bass. The call quality is excellent.  The controls are functional and straight forward.  The battery life is amazing.

Though I mentioned that they feel light and inexpensive, I like the way they feel.  Being so lightweight makes them very agreeable to wear and doesn’t give me a headache from the pressure and weight.

As I’ve said, you don’t get very deep bass, but more than half of the content I use these headphone with are audiobooks.  Even when I do listen to music, I am not displeased with the sound.  Granted, much of my music doesn’t emphasize deep bass, but my point is that these headphones are good enough that I never really think too much about sound quality.  And again, call quality with these are excellent.  Even better than I anticipated.

I had to consult the manual to know how to consistently summon Siri, but otherwise, the controls are very intuitive.  Honestly, it’s hard to mess up.  Five buttons: Volume up, down,  Forward, Back, time sensitive play/pause button that functions as an on-off switch and voice command prompter.

The battery life is amazing.  I’ve actually never depleted the battery.  If you leave it on standby without plugging it in for a week or so, it will still hold its charge.  On the iPhone, it even displays a battery percentage meter.

My ONLY complaint:  They really have no passive sound cancellation.  External noises are slightly muffled, but really they’re quite meager in terms of sound dampening.  I was not expecting  anything resembling Bose noise cancellation at all, but given the size of the headset and the large over-ear muffs, I really did think that they would passively block a little more external sound.  But when the music is playing, you don’t notice too much, so even this is fine.

If I had excessive splurging money this year, maybe I’d have gotten a Bose headset, but at $30, I don’t think there is a better deal out there for the time being.  I’ll use them until they break, and keep recommending them to people at least until that time.

author: Janelle
title: Good for a month or two
content:
These headphones, for the price point, did exactly what I wanted them to do. They didn't really cancel noise, but I didn't get them for that anyway (I hate the kind that go IN your ear- so these were perfect). Then about 2 months in, the music started to sound muffled. I don't listen to super loud crazy music, and nothing happened to the headphones to cause this. They were working fine at work, I went home, I came back in in the morning and they no longer worked. Despite my attempts to problem solve, I was unable to fix. The sounds distortion really just makes these unusable.
It's probably worth paying more for a pair that will last.

I will say, battery life is pretty good. If you can handle muffled, distorted playback, they'll last for days.

author: Stephen Morrison Lewis
title: Muddy Wireless Sound
content:
Since my biggest complaint is going to be about the sound, allow me to say this: I don't understand why it's a problem, but the Bluetooth audio sounds muddled and of mediocre quality.  This is puzzling because when I plugged it in to my LG V30 with a wired connection, I could get high quality audio through the quad DAC that sounded nearly as good as my wired studio monitor headphnes that cost over a hundred dollars more.  That sound quality is pretty fantastic for a headphone in this price range in my experience, but I didn't buy this because it was a good wired device, I bought it for the wireless capabilities, and there, it seems to lag considerably in quality.  I've used ten dollar sets with crisper sound.  I'm not comparing this to high-end Bluetooth numbers, or even phones with aptX or AAC.  Until recently, my go-to was a pair of 18 dollar, behind the head headphones which had better sound quality.  This is a major problem for me.

Otherwise?  This is a decent set of headphones.  The build feels pretty sturdy and I'm not worried I'm going to break them, the wired sound is impressive, and the battery life seems at least standard.  It's hard to completely judge, though, as I find the wireless sound unsatisfying enough that I've not listened for long periods.

My other major complaint is with the on-ear controls.  I like the ability of wireless headphones to control music right from the set or bud, as it allows me to stick my phone in my pocket and just leave it there.  This set has a ring that makes it difficult to press only the button you want.  The ring is flush enough with the rest of the device that  have difficulty finding it with lightly guitar-calloused fingers, while other sets are not so much of a problem here.  If there is any raised or indented pattern to tell which button you're hitting, it's also too fine to be detected through what are some fairly mild callouses.

All things considered, I can't recommend these headphones, but they're not the worst I've ever used.  The wired functionality does mean I don't have to take out my more expensive headphones for decent over-the-ear sound.  It just means I have to sacrifice quality audio, which is already at a premium in wireless sound.

author: ER
title: I needed an economical set for my son so he can beat the crap out of them without breaking the bank
content:
I am very picky with headphones. I evaluate specs in paper vs how the really sound, fit, built and cost. I needed an economical set for my son so he can beat the crap out of them without breaking the bank. I said to myself. "Well they might not be as good as some other more expensive models", but I was wrong. I am amazed with these.

These headsets have the ability to work wired or wireless which is a big plus. In wireless mode (Bluetooth), the battery last pretty much what they advertise and the phone, track and volume control and microphone works amazing. Also they very easy to pair. In wired just plug the 3.5mm cable in to the outlet and done. They are very comfortable and not as heavy as they look. What I do not like is that the outer side of the headband is a finger print magnet.

Don't get me wrong, for answering a phone call and then listen some music or playing a game you can't go wrong.

I used to rate these at 4 stars, but... While I love and support the Mpow headphones, this set is falling a bit short for me. It's supposed to offer bluetooth support for both my phone and my computer, but it often will only play sound from one, and not the other. If I try to switch back and forth between my phone and my computer, there are definite issues, and I usually have to turn my headphones completely off in order to reset everything to working order.

Also, very disappointed that the exterior covering is coming unglued on the headset's crown area, and I have attached images showing the ungluing. Overall, I loved this headset, but it's not as good as I thought it was when I first received them. Downgrading to three stars.

author: jemgirl
title: Love love love!
content: These headphones flipping rock my socks off.  I'll be honest, I have a fat head so they are a bit tight on me for just regular chilling-at-my-work desk... but man oh man when I'm sprinting around house-cleaning or cooking in the kitchen, it's nice to have a pair of headphones that won't fall off my head.  Sound quality, bluetooth strength, and battery are all wonderful.  I love that I have the option to plug in an aux cord or use them wirelessly- if you have the aux cord plugged in, they automatically turn off and they don't use battery at all.  I bought a cheaper pair for my desk at work and honestly, I hate them.  hahaha! So I'll be purchasing another pair of these so I can have a pair at home and a pair at work.  You really can't go wrong with these!

author: Mitch
title: Not for music
content:
Honestly this is probably one of the most disappointing purchases I've ever made on Amazon. When the headphones came out of the package, I was very surprised by how nice it looked. The design is sleek, the material feels fairly sturdy, and the interface is simple and easy to use. When I put it on it fit very snugly without clamping too tightly, and was warm but not uncomfortably hot. It even came with split audio and mic jacks instead of one dual jack. It was very promising and had all the makings for a great pair of headphones, but when I actually tried listening to it I was sorely disappointed. It's like when they were designing this thing, they blew all of their budget right before they got to the sound part. The audio is tinny, scratchy, and overall just sounds incredibly cheap, especially around the midrange. There is a constant hissing when sound is playing, and to be honest it just has the audio quality of something you can buy at the dollar store. I think I wouldn't have been let down as much if the headphones itself also looked shoddy, but it didn't. A shame that something with such a slick design left so much to be wanted in terms of where it actually mattered.

If the makers of these headphones read this, I want you to know that I would gladly pay double the price for these if you make one with at least acceptable sound quality.

Edit:
The customer service however, is top notch! They sent me a new pair immediately after my review. I'll be keeping an eye on this seller for when they release new models, and hopefully find one with improved sound quality.

author: Jake
title: Too loud, too deep, lacks clarity.
content:
I was looking for some headphones in the lower price range to use with music and PC gaming as an alternative to my favorite in-ear buds. I bought Mpow 059, H17 and H12 headphones for comparison But ultimately settled with the H12.

The H59 was comfortable and the flatter padding on the headband was desirable to me. These do not have ANC. The sound was overly full, muddy at some points and lacked clarity. The volume is louder than all my other Bluetooth and hurt my ears if I did not trun it down when switching from the other devices. I sent them back!

The H12 is what I ended up liking the most. I wish the headband pad was a little flatter because rounded padding prickles my short hair but beyond that they are comfortable.
The ANC takes almost 2 seconds to turn on and then it provides an ambient white noise similar to what you hear in your speakers when a tape deck is played with no tape or at the start/end of recording. It will completely eliminate the sound of my computer fans, refrigerator, air conditioning  and water cooler. I can still hear voices and some other noises like loud cars and bathroom fans but any amount of music will drown those out if the ANC is already on.
The H12 naturally has a very Full sound, but if bass boost is used the bass can bleed into mids and sound muddy. In my opinion the ANC enhances mids and most music sounds best with ANC on and PC sound enhancements disabled. I could probably expect higher quality sound out of these but I'm still enjoying it and the price was right. One thing to add, Harsh noises, like if someone adjusts a mic/camera in a video, come across startlingly convincing almost as if you think someone is tapping/ grabbing on the headphone frame itself. This was also the case with the H17

On the H17 first thing I noticed was the stitching around the ear muffs, unlike the pictures stitching was over tight and it drug on my fingers, I could feel its texture on my head too and I did not like it. The ear openings are too round and did not go around my ears as comfortably either. The headband padding was curved and ribbed and I did not like it on my short hair. As a positive the ANC switches on much faster but its performance was equal to the H12 ANC. Sound quality was a little deeper and fuller than H12 some may like this but I thought it was too much.  Much like the H12 I think the H17 sounds best with ANC on and PC sound enhancements disabled. I did not keep these long enough to appreciate the fast charging feature but I'm sure It would be nice to have.

author: Gary Lee
title: What you get for cheap price, I guess...
content: It pairs up with the TV, very well. The manner of controlling (on and off and volume) is easy. They are pretty comfortable and adjustable for larger heads. They would be Very good for someone that has difficulty in hearing... The volume is Too loud for me and my hearing isn't great. When I turn the volume down to it's lowest point, it is still Too loud for My ears. I have to set the headphones halfway off my ears, to deal with the loud sound. If I try to tune it any lower, it goes "MUTE". If the TV volume is left on, even at it's lowest point (still putting out some sound), I hear a constant echo in the headset. Visual wise, it may drive you crazy, because the sound from the headphones are slightly delayed, to the motion of the people speaking on the TV set. (news, movies, etc.)

author: Amazon Customer
title: Unbelievable specs and quality for the price.
content:
Love these headphones! Look great, are super comfortable, and can't believe I can take phone calls on them! The sound is clear and loud, they are easy to fold up and put away, easy to pair with your phone or any blue tooth device. I got them to use at the gym and love that they are cordless. Wear a ponytail to keep them from slipping off backwards while you're active.
Came with a nice velvet case, charging cord, instructions, and cord to connect to laptop or computer.
The only issue I have is that the control buttons on the earpiece are too close together so I'll set off the phone when I want to change a song.

author: Yas
title: Edited
content:
Edited: 2 Days after I wrote this review the company contacted me and sent me another pair free of charge. The new pair worked perfectly. They deserve 5 stars for their customer service alone.

I’ve only had them a few days and I’m already experiencing issues. Issues so bad I can’t wear them:
1. The sound in the right ear is way lower than the left ear. It’s been like that since the day I received them. I can barely hear out of the right ear.
2: They heat up very fast. I’m not talking an hour or so of use, my pair heats up after 10 minutes of use. The headphones get so hot I have to take them off.
3: The padding is very stiff and hard making them uncomfortable on the skin.
4: They are very very uncomfortable. My heads not that big yet they squeezed on my jawbone (by the ears) so bad I couldn’t wear them longer than a few minutes. My jaw was hurting for quite sometime afterwards.
I don’t know if I received a defective pair but they are NOT worth the money. Im disappointed because MPOW usually has good products. This is not one of those good products.

author: Phantom Reviewer
title: Great for hard of hearing
content:
We have a unique situation where my brother, who has Down syndrome is very hard of hearing- and refuses to wear his hearing aid. He is also autistic, and spends a great deal of time in his room watching one game show after another. I doubt he could hear much, and I'm certain he missed out on half-if not all the voices.
Sooooo...I found these headphones on Amazon, and they had a great rating. Bought a blue tooth thingy to connect them to the TV.
I saw my brother smile for the first time in forever. He was able, even with his hearing loss, to hear the TV. Even if he goes down the hall to another room, the voice from the TV carries.
I would have spent 1000$ for these headphones that have made such a difference in the quality of his life.
They are so comfortable! The clarity is outstanding. The range is waaaaay more than I would have thought possible.
I would recommend these for anyone hearing impaired- the difference between silence and being able to interact with sounds from TV, or radio would make a huge difference for the hearing impaired.

author: Tony Bianco
title: Non-Existant Bass. All High End.
content:
5 stars for comfort. 1.5 to 2 stars for sound. My $9 Skullcandy earbuds have better sound than these headphones. The bass is flat. I'm going to probably return these because the sound is garbage. It's all high end. Even with an EQ app on my macbook it's still terrible. Put my little $9 earbuds in and the sound is booming. I bought these because of all of the positive reviews. So I'd have to say if you don't care about bass and you want comfort, then these could be your headphones for sure. However, if you want at least some bass then you'll be better off looking elsewhere.

Downgrading this to 1 star because now I found out I have to pay to ship these back to the seller. So I'm out $8 for buying crappy headphones that I can't keep.

author: Ron S.
title: Two Failures?
content: I purchased two of these on Aug 18. 2017.  One failed in approximately 90 days and one in 110 days.  Both outside the Amazon return window.  Requested help (or at least sympathy..lol) from the shipper and received none.  I do recognize that the shipper does not warrant the product; however, they normally have a better rapport  with the manufacturer they represent.  The units worked great until they both failed to pair with any of several devices they had been pairing with.  This is the first negative review I can remember giving.

author: Albie Llada
title: Good for music, and not so good outdoor hands free phone use
content:
This product seems to be a knock off of the previous brand Senty. The price is good. Maybe a little more expensive than when Senty had them on Amazon..I also notice that it is inferior to the Senty brand of the same design and battery capacity. The Senty brand had noise cancellation on the microphone for phone conversations.

This one does not have the feature of noise cancellation.  You need to be where the noise is minimal. I wonder why they made this product without noise cancellation. I use to enjoy talking in the Streets of Manhattan without people complaining about the background noise on the Senty model.
I MPOW-059 is good forlistening.
Is this brand owned by Amazon or what?.
Overall, you do get good sound without needing to hear the base on a loud speaker.
The headset tends to get a short circuit, and leaves a little lighting on where bluetooth signal lights blink from.  Now, a year later, this headset is starting to turn off by itself.  Also, the color pad on the headset has unglued itself. I am hoping MPOw will replace my headphones. The similar brand called Senty, never gave me this trouble with its durability.

I am now forced to hear conversations on the bus because my MPOW isn't working now

author: Dylan Fan
title: Excellent Headphones for Low Cost Bluetooth Solution.
content:
I've probably owned 25 different kinds of headphones over the years -- from cheap, cheap to multiple hundred dollars in cost. Expensive ones have broken; cheap ones have held up for a while.  But I still ended up needing a pair of inexpensive, bluetooth headphones to use when watching TV or listening to music while going to sleep.  These were cheap (about $35) but had good reviews so I decided to try them.

What a surprise.  Decent sound quality (I'm older and my hearing isn't what it used to be, but they have reasonably solid bass and the frequency response seems smooth to me).  The sound quality isn't what you'll get from really high grade headphones but the build quality is good and it is, after all, being used with an iPhone playing mp3s.  And it is quite an upgrade from using earbuds.

I'm pretty sure I could not have gotten a better value for the money.  They are solid and although I've only had for a couple months, I think they're going to hold up well over time.  Pairing is easy and they don't seem to require recharging too frequently.

Anyone who has $40 or $50 expectations should be very pleasantly surprised with both the sound and the build quality on these.

author: Sevigny Lecesne
title: Great, great customer service!!!
content: Previously, I wrote a very scathing, though very accurate, genuine review. I am now very impressed and satisfied with the great customer service I received from this vendor. I was not going to go through the returns process in that I was completely done with those headphones; boxing them up and returning them would be my "jumping through hoops". However, this vendor understands great customer service -- to the point that they contacted me and sent me a replacement. I very much appreciate these types of forward thinking and positive reactions. Other businesses would do well to follow the lead of this vendor. Businesses claim to know the concept of demographics but they have no idea of its implications: most business count the number of complaints, bad reviews; mince numbers and conclude that "you are the ONLY complaint we received", not realizing that ONE person could represent 1,000, 1 million, 10 million people, depending on the representative size. So, by this ONE act of great customer service by this vendor, they most likely have addressed the problems of thousands of customers with the same problem I had but did bother to write a review. WELL DONE to this vendor, patuo xun! GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! Thank you very much!!!

author: TrojanCatSteve
title: Not for exercise or inspiration.
content:
Poor sound quality (audio book quality). Nice looking. I wouldn’t buy again or recommend unless it was for a child or someone who listens to audiobooks.
Some of you will understand this and some of you won’t: good music with good headphones can inspire you and make you really appreciate an artists voice. Good music with poor headphones does neither of those. My test is simple, go to the gym or go on a run and listen to some high energy music. Does the song sound great and make you want to keep pushing? Put on Mama Said Knock You Out by Ll Cool J. Do you want to do what mama said to do? Play Enter Sandman by Metallica. Do you want to say, “wow this was an awesome song!”?! Or do you say, “meh, that song is old and dated”?
If great music has no more effect on your ears, spirit, or soul than a Celine Dion song (no offense Celine) than you have some bad earphones.
While they look fun and offer bluetooth, they are unable to provide all of the tones you want in your music.
Skip the functionality and go with some that provide better sound quality.

author: Paul
title: Updated AGAIN! - Mpow ROCKS! (NOT) Absolutely AWFUL sound quality
content:
A company that stands behind their products!  MPOW ..I am now a loyal customer. After seeing my initial review, Mpow went to great lengths to make me a happy customer. (no..they didn't compensate me in any way to change my review..in case that's what you are thinking) So rare to see a company do  that. Their stuff is a great value and excellent quality. Try it.. you'll see for yourself.. and they see  to it that you are satisfied. BRAVO!!!

FIRST i said: reminiscent of those little white "ear plugs" that came with transistor radios back in the 60s.  TERRIBLE!"
**UPDATE** Ok.. so my first experience was not good.. but I "re-paired" the headset and found the sound to be considerably better.  So I'll say that, while these aren't exactly the audiophile's dream, they "ain't bad for the price" at all.  So if you get a pair that sounds like a tin can at first.. disconnect and "re-pair" them.  It did the trick for me. I'd recommend them for the parent who need's a headset for their kids. They are light weight, fold up nice and seem comfortable.

author: Gallowizard
title: GREAT headphones for the price and an awesome company to work with
content:
I had my first pair of these for about 7 months and used them pretty much daily in the gym, working in the yard, walking the dogs ect. and I have a few things to say about the quality

The battery life is ABSURDLY LONG, even with daily use I maybe charged them every 2 weeks and they charge quickly.
The sound quality for $40 headphones is excellent! They pair easily with bluetooth and you can have multiple devices programmed into the memory to swap pretty easily. The low end bass isn't necessarily great but that isn't too much of a setback. If you have an android device with Dolby Atmos it really does make a difference to switch that on.
The ear pads and top pad are pretty tough, after months of daily sweat and heat abuse (I sweat... a lot) they haven't had any visible deterioration, which is impressive if you are the kind of human that wears full sized phones to the gym.

To add to all of this.. I was out for a walk and got caught in a HEAVY rainstorm that soaked the headphones. They worked for another few days until they needed charged and that is when I realized that the charging port was dead (presumably because of said rain) and I was not too bummed out, they are just $40, I'll buy another set!

Before I did that, I reached out to see if the company had any ideas or could possibly just send me a replacement port that I could install but instead they just sent me a WHOLE NEW pair of headphones! Great and responsive customer service that I definitely did not expect from this price point. Also, the old headphones still work if they are connected with the included audio cable. They only need to be charged and 'on' for the bluetooth to work. They've certainly got my business.

author: Vanessa Rutherford
title: Love Em!
content:
I've tried Beats and Bose headphones on demo and I honestly can not tell a difference. These are comfortable against the ears and the sound quality is great. There's also a remote on the headphones to change volume & songs or answer phone calls. The noise cancellation works well too, but I haven't tested them with extremely loud noises. Just basic stuff like using a vacuum while cleaning up. Of course, if they'll silence a vacuum, I have all the confidence in the world that they'd work on a flight with small children, in a crowded gym, or any other noisy situation you can think of. I can't speak on how well the battery lasts, as I'm pretty diligent about charging them after each use, but they do have a cord just in case they die or you can't charge them. Also, for the runners and bodybuilders, I have no idea how these hold up to moisture, so maybe be mindful of sweat and dry them after each use. Definitely give them a tight fit on the head and try not to leave them battered and bruised. I haven't tested durability either, but dropping electronics is never good for them. Especially cheap electronics. Lol

These have tons of good reviews for a reason. So far, I'm satisfied. They seem to be made well and I know that they work well, so they're more than worth thirty bucks. Like most anything, if they're taken care of, they should be fine. If they commit some grave offense in the near future like not holding a charge or literally falling apart, I'll come back and tell you about it.

author: Her Unicorn
title: Half ok Half not so ok
content:
Im not the greatest with typing a bunch due to carpal tunnel but i will try to make this a decent but short review

I really really love these headsets with my compute. They work great for both gaming and streaming the type of music i listen to. I was worried from some of the reviews that music would be an issue but i have not heard an issue with sound. So there is that. As for fit, they fit perfect and cover my ears perfect i suppose someone with a larger head and bigger ears might disagree with me. I read a few of the not so great reviews and people complained how cheaply made they were and easily they broke. Call me an optimist but i dont see that happening unless you just carelessly fling them around and dont take care of them.

Now for the bad...I honestly dont know if its the headset or if its the fact im connected to two devices or if its because my phone is just a piece of...but while im on my computer and the phone rings, when i push the button and it answers the phone, it works perfectly the way it should answering the phone and turning sound off from the computer. That being said though, i am told by those i talk to using the headset that i am sounding like a robot and shakey or they are having trouble hearing me. I have the same results though when i hear them. I also find it difficult to see the usb port where its located.

I gave the headset 3 stars for the reason of the bad. I bought it both for use with my computer and my phone but when i have to select using the phone during a call and cant use the headset as intended or like i was hoping to do so that my hands could be free to continue playing a game or so that i could walk away from the phone cause its on charge it sort of defeats the purpose of why i bought the headset. Yes i also needed it for gaming nights with friends on discord and streaming music but the number one reason was for phone use.  -sighs- i guess i cant win them all.

author: Crystal Starr Light
title: I can focus at work again!
content:
My office got the redesign and I was the lucky one to have a cube right off the main highway. Immediately, I knew this would be a distraction to me - both hearing everyone enter and exit the office and then having everyone think they can talk to me. So I wanted an over the ear set of headphones that 1) would cancel/block some of the noise, 2) would let people know I was listening to music, 3) had great sound quality, and 4) didn't break the bank. This set was exactly that - and it came in my favorite color, pink!

This set pairs great with my iPod and my iPhone - even better, I was able to figure out how to pair it with my laptop for those late phone-in meetings. That said, I've found that the bluetooth sound quality in phone calls was not as good as the line in, but I think we all understand that issue.

The battery lasts a LONG time - I have never had it quit on me (but then, generally, I plug it in during lunch). I don't hear my coworkers nearly so much, but can still hear my desk phone. And people know now that I'm not just ignoring them because I don't like them, I'm listening to music. If there are negatives, they are 1) that the design causes my hair to get caught and and 2) the discomfort on my ears when I wear really dangly earrings.

Overall, this set has been fantastic - I never imagined using them for conference calls, but they've worked great! I'm hoping they last a long long time because I like them very much!

author: Camilla Kaplan
title: Fantastic for the price!
content:
Edited on 10/29/19:
After leaving a mixed review, a representative contacted me to tell me they had shipped me a new set of headphones to replace my faulty ones. I've since received the new headset. Hopefully this pair lasts!

I appreciate the good customer service, proactively replacing my clearly faulty headphones with new ones. The new set seems to work well. The one thing that makes this headset less than ideal is that it doesn't always work well when you have two devices paired—sometimes you can't pair the second device without disconnecting, and any sound from my phone causes the sound from my computer to stop until I disconnect the phone. They're still pretty great, though, within that small limitation! Good sound, nice look, good customer support, great price point. I definitely recommend them.

Original review:
I bought these earlier this year and really, really loved them for a while. Good sound, great for calls, comfortable, nice color, great battery life, excellent price point. I recommended them to several people. Then the fabric started pulling away from the band on top and exposing the foam underneath, which was a pain. But I superglued it back on cause hey, as long as they worked well, I was okay with them looking ugly. Then they stopped connecting to my phone via Bluetooth, which was...90% of why I wanted them. They still connect to my computer, but not reliably and with more static and dropping the signal.

Really bummed that they didn't last longer, because I really liked them and was otherwise happy with them. But if they barely last six months, that great price point suddenly looks a lot less impressive.

author: P_J_P
title: Hear Me Out - Try These.
content:
I can't say much more than what has been said already in regard to these phones. This headset is a winner. I use it almost exclusively while watching movies on my Amazon Fire. I have had no issues with Bluetooth connection. Because of the nice fit over the ears, most exterior sounds are blocked out.

I had to laugh at one reviewer's complaint that the headset "jiggled" while he ran. This set is no more designed for running than a pair of iron-tipped work boots.

And an additional feature which is very handy: If the battery wears out in the middle of whatever you are doing, you can plug these right into your system and keep on going. A cable is provided with the head set. This feature has kept me going several times.

The prices I see for "name-brand" headphones are just ridiculous.  Don't spend you hard-earned money for a name on the product. Keep about $270 in your pocket and purchase these for about $30.

I've never heard of Mpow before...but I know what sounds good to me. I recommend this item - highly.

author: Apple
title: Good and Bad
content: I purchased a pink one back in August.  When I first received it, i thought it's excellent! Compared to my previous earphones ive had, this is by far my favorite of all. I love the color, the design, the ear muffs are soft.. it doesnt hurt my ears, i even fall asleep with them on. At first i used the bluetooth but now i love using the 3.5mm jack with it... sound is good, it sounds like, when I use my iphone earphones... the sound quality is similar to that. But after almost 2 months of use, the right speaker lost its sound, i could not hear anything on the right speaker, i feel like i lost my hearing.. there is no sound whatever, cabled or bluetooth, there is no sound .. and only used it for 2 months, considering I take care of my headphones a lot.... the overall quality is poor. My amazon return window is now closed, so i contacted Mpow CS directly, I am just waiting for their response. I will keep you guys updated.

author: Anthony L
title: Update / Edit
content:
Plastic material feels cheap. But, it works for what I need it for. And it didn't break the bank. Not for audiophiles, but, at this price point you'll be satified with the sound. Nor will you be upset if/when they break.

EDIT/UPDATE: November 17, 2019
Reference the Mpow H20 headphones.
5☆☆☆☆☆ rating!

Recently I was fortunate enough to receive a pair of (Mpow H20) wireless headphones to review as an alternative to the (059) model. While those were sufficient they are by no means in the same league as the (H20's).
The Mpow H20 headphones are in a word (Amazing)! The Highs are nice and crisp. The Mids are solid and the Bass is deep, low and rich in sound quality. I put these on the moment I received them, hit play on one of my favorite tunes and Bam! The smile that instantly came on my face was uncontrollable. They sound just that good! I couldn't believe it so I stopped the music and played another song from a different genre. And too my surprise, the smile was back! The feel is Premium to the touch. The build quality is Solid. And the Sound, Wow! I spent alot more money a couple of years ago on a pair of (Beats Solo 2) headphones. These Mpow H20 headphones blows them out of the water.
Also, I've noticed that the battery life is insanely long. I've gotten approximately 27 hours of (variable volume) use time, and there is still a charge on them. I also like how easy they instantly connect tho whatever device they were last paired to. They are the most comfortable over the ear headphones I have worn to date.
I Highly recommend the Mpow H20 headphones to anyone. They make a Great gift for anyone and to treat yourself to some quality sound.
Lastly I would be remiss if I didn't mention that there is no noise cancelling on this particular pair of headphones. But, that doesn't affect the range and sound quality of the headphones. If you really need noise cancelling, I'm sure Mpow has something that would meet your needs. As for me, these are perfect! 5☆☆☆☆☆ all the way!

author: Christine Trostel
title: UPDATED
content:
UPDATE-just received a new pair in the mail. I didn't ask for a new pair.  I assume the company is sending them for me to try again. I must have got a busted set.  I have no thad a chance to try the new ones. But nice customer service!
Pure junk! They don’t work!!! I have a very sad little girl. This was a Christmas present. The sounds comes out muffled and staticky. How is that possible?! Anyway... save yourself time, money, and disappointment.

author: MRB
title: Good deal
content:
**Pros:
Very comfortable. I love the over ear design as opposed to the on ears I had before.

1 charge lasts awhile.

Price is reasonable for the quality.

Sound is nice and I appreciate that the seller spelled out in the description that these weren't noise canceling headphones.

*cons-
None for now
**update 9/30/18- after a bit over a year of gentle use (about an hour a day while I walk so no jarring activity. Never been dropped or stored improperly either.) I went to turn these on and they randomly stopped working completely. They were fully charged and suffered no trauma. Just dead. I liked them a lot while they lasted but for the price I really expected longer life.

*Other info-
The manual controls on this unit (on the outer right side) are a power/connect button with phone and play/pause options in the middle, with volume controls on top and bottom, and a skip back and forward on each side. It's fairly simple in setup and I find it easy to use as the consumer.

author: Boy mom
title: great value, super comfortable and compact.
content: I love these head phones, they are perfect for my needs. I needed a pair of wireless headphones for my 2 year old, who has sensory issues. He loves to use them in crowds or places that have alot going on. He uses them both with and with out music. The headphones are adjustable and really soft, so the texture dosent up set my little one .I love them for long car rides so he can watch movies I dont have to worry about a wire. We keep them charged so for his pair we dont use the cord, he would chew thur it. I enjoyed them so much i got another pair in blue for my 8 year old. Now he is really hard on head phones, and after a month hes already messed up the cord to make them into wired headphones. I just bought a new one and so far so good. He uses them for on the bus and free time at home and can get a good 20 hours before  needing to charge them. The bluetooth has great range, he can be a room away and still work. He tho forgets alot to charge them so the cord option saves him. I waited alittle over a month to do a review to see how they held up, and I can honestly say they are great. They have been threw in pack packs and tossed around by a hyperactive two year old. They come with a nice little bag, charger, and auxiliary cord. They are not going to have the sound quality or noise cancellation like a $120+ pair. But they hold there own, they sound good, durable, fold up to a nice size, adjustable, bluetooth and comfortable.

author: Rose
title: Good quality for the price
content:
I haven't had these headphones long but I've been using them nonstop all day at work. They came out of the box with 80% battery according to my phone and have only dropped to 60% after about 5 hours of use.

Right out of the box they were easy to connect, no fuss like many Bluetooth devices. They can also be connected to two different phones so you can share them with someone if need be. I did notice the ear pad that was on the inside of the fold was dented in where it had been packaged up for so long. I let it sit overnight and it went back to its original shape.

The headphones have separate volume settings than the phone you connect it to. So you can max then headphone's volume and then your phone's and it'll be blasting the music. Wouldn't recommend it for the durability of the headphones though.

I was afraid they'd be too small but they extend to fit a bigger head. They are a bit tight, which would be helpful if you're intending to use them for the gym. I mainly bought these for use at the gym so I'll update with how well they stay on my head through running, lifting, etc. However, if you get headaches or are sensitive to things being on your head a little tight, these might not be for you.

Update: at the gym. Working well for lifting weights and bike. They didn’t stay on my head when I did ab workouts though. They kept slipping off so I just took them off for that portion. Might be the size of my head though.

There is a 3.5mm port in the bottom of the left earpiece for an aux cord if you need to plug in to a non-Bluetooth device. I plugged it into my PS4 controller and I could hear my system audio. I haven't tested the mic for game chat yet, but I think it'll work. May update later once I test it.

Overall I like the functionality and feel of the headphones. They're comfortable, the sound quality is good for the price. Some sound escapes to the outside world but you can't hear anything outside of them when wearing them.

author: Cautious of Reviews
title: Would Give It Negative Stars
content:
First the pros: The battery life is truly amazing. I charGe it like once a week and I am good to go. The sounds quality at first is amazing but that lasts about 2 months. It is also pretty good at noise cancelling.

The cons:
1. The product fell apart on me after about 2 months. I mean physically fell apart as in the fabric starts falling off and then the cushion part starts falling off and I tried to work with it. I kept using it because sound was still coming out and for the price it is to be expected.

2. Then it started having problems connecting about a couple of weeks later. So it would connect to my phone and my computer and then automatically this connect itself and I would have to turn it off and start over. Then weirdly enough it started connecting directly with my phone as soon as I turned it on even though the bluetooth function on my phone was off, I tested it a couple of times and then saw that the actual bluetooth on my phone turn blue when the voice on the headphones says pairing (it creeped me out a lot).

3. After all of that, it started beeping and I have checked, its not the battery. It's this nonstop just beeping every couple seconds. You can't hear anything over the beep because it stops your thing that's playing to beep.

4.The customer service is not great. They offer to swap the product after 30 days but you have to pay for shipping to their warehouse in California which for me ends up being about half of the cost of product and they won't reimburse me for that full amount.

I know people want to say you get what you pay for but honestly not in this case. There are headphones under $30 that work well longterm without all of these problems and I didn't pay for bad customer service. I am not some know it all expert on headphones, I just want ones that work and I read a lot of great reviews which is why I went with this one but just know these things can happen. It was overall a really long, frustrating and negative experience.

author: jtf8044
title: Terrible audio stuttering, constantly have to restart the headphones
content:
Fit and finish of the headphones is decent, and the sound quality is decent. But wow, these headphones have some of the worst audio stuttering I've ever encountered in a Bluetooth headphone. Broken, stuttering audio if you pause your media for over 3 minutes, forcing you to power cycle the headphones to re-establish a solid connection. Happens consistently, regardless of the battery level. Can't recommend with the frequency of stuttering that occurs.

Update: The merchant reached out after seeing this review and sent a replacement headset. The new headset functions much better!

author: TuCool
title: Easy to set up the connection between my phone and ...
content:
Can't beat these for the price. Easy to set up the connection between my phone and these headphones and now they connect automatically every time I turn the headphones on. I like that there are buttons on the side of the headphone to play/pause, skip songs and adjust the volume. The buttons are a bit hard to feel at first since they're smooth but once you get used to the placement you can find the button you are looking for pretty easily. The headphones are comfortable for about 1.5 hours and after that they can make my ears hurt because they press down on them. I don't mind this because I only wear these on the train when I'm commuting and so I wear them for about an hour maximum at a time. If you are looking for headphones to wear all day these may not be for you because they can get uncomfortable after a length of time.

The sound quality is good and noise does leak if you play your music super loudly. But if you listen to it at a medium level the people around you should not be able to hear your music. I like that it comes with a cord to plug in if your headphones run out of battery. The battery lasts a long time. I get my full 15 hours worth of battery life out of my headphones before i have to charge them. I charge them about once a week. Overall, if you are not willing to spend a lot of money on headphones and just looking for something to do the job, these are a great choice.

author: Wei Xiong
title: Disappointed: there's an annoying noise that comes on and off when connected through Bluetooth
content:
--- update 9/8/2018 ---

Raising the rating by one star because of good customer service.

After leaving my initial review, I was contacted by customer service. They sent me an replacement (Mpow H2) for me to try. My original complaint was about sound quality. H2, in my opinion, indeed has better sound, but it's not nearly as comfortable as 059. I can't really recommend either. But again, there are budget headphones. Maybe I'm asking too much for this price range. I supposed this pair could be decent enough for a budget-oriented consumer.

--- original review ---

Initially, I purchased another pair of headphones on Amazon for less than half of what the Mpow costs. That other pair has OK sound but it's very uncomfortable and gets irritating very quickly. So I returned that pair and purchased Mpow instead based on the reviews.

As it turns out, Mpow is indeed quite comfortable which is a big plus. However, the sound quality is not good. What's particularly annoying is the fuzzy noise that comes on and off when it's connected through Bluetooth. If connected through the cable, the sound quality gets a lot better and the noise won't be there. But let's be real, I didn't buy these wireless headphones so that I can use them with wire. In fact, some other reviewers have also reported similar issues with the noise so I'm guess it's quite a common problem.

Ultimately, headphones are about the sound. If the sound isn't great, you wouldn't want to use it no matter how comfortable they fit on your head. Disappointed.

author: Meg
title: Listening with Friends
content: I really enjoy these and love the color. They were a good price for headphones that look expensive lol. I wore these while traveling from the US to Guatemala and back and enjoyed every minute of it and the included aux cord also came in handy. However, 45 hours into traveling I was listening to pretty explicit music very loudly to wake me up a bit for arrival. And this is when my friend sitting next to me lets me know she can hear the music as if I had just brought a speaker. Then my other friend 2 rows up and across the isle turns around to say "I thought you WERE playing that from a speaker". Long story short, the whole plane could hear my very explicit music, but other than that they are great!

author: Chris Treadaway
title: Two issues keep this from getting 5 star review
content:
Sound quality is amazing for a computer... it's somewhat noise cancelling with great sound, so it's suitable to switch between a webex and listening to music. Two issues though:
1) when using via bluetooth on iphone 8, I find the sound quality to be very spotty to bad. The problem goes away when you send it to speaker or listen by wired headphone, so (at least for my 2 headsets) there is an issue when using this for iPhone 8.  Therefore, I use this only on the PC where the sound quality is fantastic. Note: I have had no issue with microphone in either case.
2) there is a notification in the box that you should only charge this with a 5 amp charger... which is fine. But they didn't put an actual 5 amp charger in the box. There is a usb charging cable only. It's pretty inconvenient to look around the house/office for a compatible wall charger when these folks could've easily included that in the box.

Otherwise, this is a great product.

author: Neil Wilson
title: I'm happy so far...
content:
So far they work pretty well and they are decently comfortable.  There was a few instances (3 +/- times) on the first night I used them that the sound of the TV show I was watching went to full static (painful!).  I paused the TV show and started it again and the static was gone.  It only happened that night and I have used them maybe 4 or 5 more times since then.  Maybe it was interference from something nearby, I don't know...but so far, there has not been a repeat.
This is my first ever pair of Bluetooth headphones and probably only my second pair of over-the-ear headphones so I can't really compare the quality to anything else.  I will say that the seller Patozon seems to want to provide good customer service...they have already emailed me twice asking if all is OK and providing some tips.  I believe I also saw them reply to some reviews to assist people who have issues.  Would I buy another pair of Mpow headphones and would I buy again from Patozon...as of right now, YES.  If the headphones turn out to be lemons and blow out my eardrums or something, I will definitely update this review.

author: gailikk
title: These headphones are good..
content:
These headphones are good.....but sadly the pair I purchased lost blue tooth function after two weeks (15 days).  Since I used these solely for gym work it made them worthless to me.  I attempted to contact the manufacturer for replacement or repair but the website 'contact' button didn't work.  Based on those facts I have to complain about these phones.  But I will say that prior to the Bluetooth failure I was happy with the product.  Just that without it these are just another wired pair of headphones and now I have to buy a new set (not mpow),  MPOW if you are reading this I would still love to hear from you so we can get these fixed.

Update.......And Mpow sent me another one that works just perfect.  Its comfortable (which is important since I use them for gym work) and the new one has been going strong for over a month already.  I want to thank Mpow for this since it makes me a loyal customer in the future when you stand behind your product this well.

author: anonymous
title: Update: not so good
content: My Beats headphones have worn out, and I could not afford another pair. I found these headphones on Amazon, and after a while of use, you can tell how poor the sound quality is. I did not expect another Beats. But I also did not expect the sound to be so unpleasant. The bass sounds artificial, and it can not handle mid range at all. Try listening to Kacey Musgraves and you will see what I mean about the mid range. I did give it two stars because it is pretty comfortable and pairs well. Comfort is important. But the sound is just as important, and it really lacks in the sound department. I am returning these today.

author: Steve D.
title: Great value & has it where it counts
content:
I really love these. For the price, the sound is great, they’re comfortable, portable, and having Bluetooth enabled headphones is a joy. They can even take an audio cable if you run out of juice, but honestly the battery life is so good I’ve never needed it. (Not only that but my iPhone displays how much battery charge remains... that blew me away!)

The construction feels just a little chintzy. The buttons on the headphones are certainly not luxury class. But it’s not like the thing is falling apart.

I’d never heard of MPOW but if I ever had to replace or got a chance to upgrade these I would definitely check out MPOW again. Great value, has it where it counts.

author: Sam
title: I’ve had these for two years. Still kicking!!
content:
So these are my go-to pair of headphones and I figure it’s just good karma to review it. These have held UP. I’ve had them for going on two and a half years.
I bought them originally to go with my iPhone 7 Plus, for getting around town and for exercise. I walk everywhere so it was very important to me that they were durable, and had a battery that lasted for a busy schedule and allowed me to lose track a bit. They lasted me through SEVERAL many walks to and from work, in all types of weather. They fold to fit in whatever bag I’m using; previous pairs I’ve had (not this brand) started to break on the hinges first and lasted me about half a year each. Not so here; they’re even reinforced by a couple screws on each side. I’ve went on distance runs with them, miles at a time. This week, they’ve lasted through four hour long runs with no Charger time.
I’ve dropped them quite a few times, and learned not to do that lmao, but they’re relatively unscathed (just a small crack on the bar). They’ve started rattling a bit over time, too, but it’s pretty minor and the sound usually drowns it out.
I don’t know who would be looking at these, but they’re honest to god gems. I tried to replace them recently, but the pair I got fell through and I went back to these. Great value, get em!!

author: robbrue
title: Extremely satisfied
content: These don’t claim to be “noise canceling” but I could almost believe they were. The foam pad around the ear does a great job of blocking exterior sound. Sound quality is great. Product quality has been great. Battery life has been great. The plug in wire came in handy when I arrived at the gym and found the battery was dead due to me not plugging them in all the way when I had went to charge them. That hard wire is great to plug in when on an airline as well. Extremely satisfied.

author: Wandering Soul
title: Very nice, comfortable, and good sound.
content:
Pros:
I love the fact that it's Bluetooth and wired so you can use it with older systems too.
Battery lasts a solid 8 hours at work with continuous play.
Over the ear fits nicely and is very comfortable.
The headband isn't snug or too tight like many are.
Sound is very good over Bluetooth from my phone.
You can control the volume and answer calls via the buttons built into the headphones.

Cons:
I had a bit of a hard time getting the Bluetooth to connect but once paired they work very well.
There is no tactile feature on the buttons so it's hard to feel if you are on the volume button or the on/off button.  It would be nice to have the buttons contoured in some manner to allow you to control without having to look.

As a 20 year member of Amazon I rely on independent reviews when shopping and I will always try to be as honest and impartial as I can and will try to provide helpful insight into the product. I am reviewing this product as it relates to how it works for me in my intended use. I tend to review products that I really like, or that let me down in some manner. If you found this review helpful, then please click the "HELPFUL" link below! Thank you, and HAPPY SHOPPING!

author: c0ker666
title: Good sound but bad durability
content:
After about a week of use the padding on the center head price totally came off and I'm having to use ductape to keep my hair from getting caught on it. I constantly have to fight between my phone and computer for connection. I typically use this with my computer but since my phone is constantly on it is wanting to connect before my computer.
