Power wise: it can usually hold a charge for about three days and that's with using it for about 4 hours a day which is really good. It does let you know when the battery is getting close to dead with both audible sounds and visual (red lights) which is nice.

Sound quality: I do have to say the that sound quality is really good with these headphones and the bass is pretty good too.

UPDATE:
After writing the original review I was contacted by the seller Patozon who apologized for the issues I was having a replaced it with the MPOWH1 which turns out to be a lot better in all aspects. The construction of the head rest is much better then the 059, they are a lot lighter, sound quality is really good. I do have to say their customer service is top notch and cares about their customers. 5* rating in my eyes.

author: NHMeggs
title: Just ok sound quality but uncomfortable and way too much bleed through
content:
I purchased these based on my wife's MPOW headset she uses daily for conference calls and has great sound quality. These were a disappointment and I returned them after trying them for a few days. The sound quality is just ok, much worse than earbuds but acceptable for the price if not for the other cons.

Pros:
- Ok sound quality
- Battery life seems good. Used several hours on one charge
- Looks like decent quality headphones
- Easy to setup and had no connection dropping issues with Bluetooth

Cons:
- Very large. I have a big head and these were clownishly big looking on me.
- Slight tinny quality to the sound both with music and spoken word. Played around with the EQ settings on my phone but couldn't correct.
- Heavy with no padding at the top (which I knew in advance from the pictures) but didn't realize the weight would make them uncomfortable after 20-30 minutes of wearing.
- Biggest con for me - I was stunned by the amount of bleed through. Listening at a pretty low to moderate volume, you can clearly hear the music/words from 20-30 feet away. Couldn't use them in public or at the office without annoying everyone around me.

author: abuseJUNKEY
title: the audio input is broken but customer support replaced the headset
content:
Got these back in April. Bluetooth works great but the audio jack on the left ear doesn't pass sound to the right ear any more. The mic wasn't worth using from the start. Super comfortable to wear though and the Bluetooth battery runs all day.

{Edit}
Looks like Patozon reached out to me and said "we learned that your item is defective within 18-months warranty. Due to this circumstance, we have sent you a new one in this case. Hope you will get it soon." They sent that e-mail Nov 25th and I've yet to receive anything. I'll update this more when I get the new set.

{edit}
I've got the new set in and it works great. Been using them over the other set I got on black Friday that hurts my head. I'd still recommend these as a good set of Bluetooth headphones.

Pros
-Customer support is active and helpful
-Super comfy to wear even for my big head
-Bluetooth battery lasts more than 12 hours of active use

Con
-The 3.5 audio (Bluetooth worked fine) stopped working right on my first set (they sent a replacement)
-The mic isn’t the greatest and people have issues understanding me on it.

Update 12/30/18
Yesterday I got up and put these on about 0830. I watched a bit of you tube, then listened to music made and few calls. After that I put on a video game until about midnight. Then I found an anime on chrunchyroll and binge watched it till around 0600. From the moment I put them on in the morning until I went to bed they were on Bluetooth battery only. They didn’t even give me a low battery warning. I ran outa power before they did. The old one needed a break during the day. The mic is much better as well. Hope this helps someone.

author: Nicole
title: Stopped Pairing With Transmitters - Had them Less than A Month! (Update in Review)
content:
**Update Below**

These headphones are testing my patience. Let me start with the good then I'll talk about the bad.

Pros: They're pretty comfortable, they weren't that expensive, they look nice and feel sturdy.

Cons: They stop pairing with my bluetooth transmitters. I have 2 different brands of transmitters and for some reason these headphones will pair with one, work for a few hours then boom, it won't pair again. I've tried making sure both headphones and transmitters were fully charged but it's a no-go. The headphones like one-night stands with my transmitters. It will work once or twice then never again. I can't tell you how many times I've tried pairing these with the two transmitters I have and it just doesn't work. Then eventually, I can't even get the headphones to pair at all! It goes from Power On to Power Off.

Completely useless if I can't use the wireless option of these headphones. I'm very disappointed.

Update: The company sent me a replacement and it's been working great! I'm able to pair it with no issues. The first pair has again began pairing with my computer's blue tooth but still won't pair with my bluetooth transmitters but that's okay since the new pair works fine.

author: Little Ace
title: Pretty decent for commuting.
content: For what they cost, these do a pretty good job. The sound quality is fine but not great (these are by no stretch of the imagination Bose headphones!), and they occasionally cut out for a moment here and there when on bluetooth mode. I use them for commuting on public transportation, and it's really nice not to have to deal with tangling cords with my bag, etc.. I also use them occasionally at my desk at work, and was worried about sound carrying over as some folks have mentioned, but I asked my officemates and no one could hear anything. I think as long as the cup is well fitted around your ear, no sound should come out. They're definitely large and in charge, but I prefer over-ear to on-ear, so that's what you get. They've held a charge amazingly well so far--I've used them off and on for over a month now and haven't yet had to charge them after their initial charge. The buttons are a little cheap feeling, and the voice confirmation of settings (power on, power off, etc.) drive me nuts, but overall they're decent enough and do the job.

author: sandra miller
title: Just okay
content: This is an edit, I realized it was my phone setting, not volume for headphones.  Received the product on time, nicely packaged.  The headphones feel "cheap", but are user friendly.  They feel a bit heavy after an hour or so, the hunt for the perfect lightweight headphone continues.  These are okay though.

author: Angelique D
title: Customer service at work!
content:
Update:  The seller has replacing my headset with a brand new one. This is what customer service looks like. I have updated my review to 3 stars. A product should be reviewed based on all aspects. Not just the physical product but the shipping time, expensive, experience in purchasing, the products performance months after.
 My reviews are always meant to be helpful opinions based on my thoughts of this product. I look towards others reviews for useful insight into items and I hope mine do the same.
Feel free to click the "helpful" button so I know if my review was beneficial. If you have questions about my product review please feel free to reach out.
Happy Shopping!

Original post:
The headphones worked great for a few weeks. But less than a month after purchasing they did not work. I purchased a new aux cord to see if that was the issue. Still did not work. Only heard sound put of one side with no bass. I really liked the design and fit. I don't recommend this product.
I should have reviewed the 1 ⭐ prior to buying. With a 20,000 review count I blindly went into purchasing without reading all reviews.

author: Slicktek50
title: A good working pair of BT Headphone for a good Price!
content:
After much consternation and roaming through a lot of the Bluetooth Headphones, I finally settled on these.  I did a lot of reading and comparing before settling, so I hope they work out well for me.  So far I have had just a little time to use them but from my initial use I have found they are well worth the research.  I wasn't looking for the world's best but I wanted a good pair of headphones that both looked good but also sounded good.  I wear hearing aids so I wanted something that would fit over my ears and not on them.  I also wanted something that had good base, with highs and lows that would not torture my hearing aides and me. (Both blowing out my hearing aides or my hearing  as I am hard of hearing not deaf).

Other than the bit of white noise you experience (and it is really minor and low) in between song, quiet time during gaming and TV they are really great.  So realistic and all in time with the transmitter.  They were very easy to pair up with my Transmitter (also a Mpow) for my TV and also my PC. All my music sounds as good as with my other headphones that connect.  I also used the wire and no difference between wired and non-wired.

I keep these in the bag that came with them as I didn't opt to buy the hard cover (it was a separate.purchase) and I keep them in my home office. The controls are easy enough to keep in mind.... Volume up, down, skipping left or right....center on/off and phone calls. I also stayed with the basic color Red/Black as it was a bit cheaper but that is the color I was originally looking for. A bit sporty.  Everything is black anymore and hard to find so I wanted something that was color contrasting and easy to find/see.

So I am hoping to use these for a long time.  Maybe I got lucky and got a good pair for a good price.

author: Savu
title: You won't regret it!
content:
I almost never write reviews, buuuuut... these are amazing! They're such high quality for the price. I love them, but the real endorsement comes from my boyfriend. He's a hardcore audiophile (thousands of dollars worth of speakers) and he was impressed with the sound quality. The noise cancelation is great, I was talking three feet away from him and he couldn't hear me! He has expensive Bose (corded) headphones and prefers these when he's mowing the lawn. Most over-ear headphones leave my ears sore, but these are large enough to fit over my entire ear and be comfortable. The range is pretty good, and man these hold a long charge. They do take four hours to get a full battery, but that's totally worth it. Seriously, you just can't go wrong with these. Just buy them already!
Update: My partner was so jealous of my headphones he went out and bought himself a pair of Bowers & Wilkins bluetooth headphones. Mine are still going strong and I use them at work every single day! Tonight I was so bummed when they died and then I realized I literally can't remember the last time I charged them.

author: Ukie
title: Hot Take: MPOW 059 > Beats Solo³
content:
I purchased these to use for working out.

I never worked out.

But I used daily and loved. I loved the control options on the left ear. I loved how it transitioned to calls. I loved that I could walk without having to look at my phone.

Then my brother gave me his Beats Solo 3 headphones. I was excited.

Then I wasn't.

The MPOW headphones had more functions from their headset than the Solo³ and it was hard to go back from that. Unfortunately, I had given my MPOW to my youngest brother.

I continued to use the Beats but I just was not as happy as I was with the MPOW headphones. So I recently repurchased a pair that was delivered to my home yesterday. Looking forward to coming home. 😊

author: Big Bruin
title: Good for young gamer
content:
Not sure why my son can't use wired headphones without twisting up the cord until they break, but it happens.  So, I wanted to get him a cheaper set of wireless headphones he could use with his PC to play Fortnight and Roblox.  The reviews were mixed about these being useful for gaming, but honestly they are excellent for what I was looking for.  I was worried that the microphone might only work with phone calls, but that is not the case.  The headphone sound quality is very good, and even though there is no boom microphone, where ever the physical microphone is works just perfectly for him to chat in game.

All he has to do is remember to charge them overnight and he is good to go for at least 2 hours the next day (headset may go much longer, but that is his absolute max per day allowed), and simply has to press and hold the "call" button on the side of the headset to wake them back up and pair the headset/microphone with his Windows 10 PC perfectly.

author: Brent and Caitlin
title: They are a waste of money
content: These headphones are cheaply made. The first pair I bought, the button to turn them on and off stopped working within the first week. This time around it has stopped working again, and I have had them for about 2 months so I'm unable to return them. They are a waste of money.

author: Kaye D Rizzuto
title: Foam padding falls apart.
content:
Update: Just days after I wrote my 6 month review, the charging jack failed. Mpow headphones won't charge, making them useless.

Original review: I bought these for my long public transportation commute and for travel. I’ve listened to music and audio books with them, 2 hours a day, 3-5 days/week for apx 6 months. The sound is good quality for my purposes. The set seems to have confusion connecting if there is more than one device in the vicinity, for ex. if my phone and iPad are both close by. I have to turn off Bluetooth on the device I’m not using or my sound will cut out every 15 seconds for about 5 seconds. It keeps doing that until I disable Bluetooth on the other device. I’ve been somewhat displeased with the construction. The foam padding started falling apart after about 4 months. I’ve had to superglue the padding back together twice so far. I’ll keep doing so until the sound goes bad or the battery quits. But I won’t be buying any mpow products in the future for that reason. I expect things to hold together better than that. Overall they have been acceptable for the money, but I won’t be going this route again.

author: EC
title: Great for The Price. OK Sound Quality.
content:
I feel like I shouldn't complain the sound quality of this headphones for the price, and I am honestly fine with the product in general considering how much I paid for it. However, it is true that I was disappointed at the sound quality. I had a high expectation after reading many rave reviews. But I learned my lesson... You can't expect that super WOW sound quality by paying only $40.
I still remember when I first tried a SONY Walkman to listen to my favorite piano cassette tape more than 30 years ago, it totally blew my mind, made me feel like I was at Gyorgy Cziffra's piano solo concert, and my head unconsciously moved to look up the ceiling with amazement.
I guess I was expecting the same kind of surprise from this headphones, but unfortunately it didn't happen... I guess I have to try one of those over $300 headphones to get that feeling again (if I can ever afford it...).
I am actually satisfied with the sound quality of this headphone when I watch TV dramas at night after my child went to bed, but not happy at all when I listen to piano music with this headphones. I am not an expert and can't find right words to describe it, but although it has great dynamics, the sound is far from the one to make you feel like you are actually at the piano concert.
Also, this headphones is a bit too tight on my head. I am a 5 foot tall Asian woman who has an average sized head for Asian (I think, lol), so not that huge head but not very small. It starts pressuring into my ear after an hour or so and since it's also heavy, the weight starts hurting my hair line unless I adjust and move it around over my head like every 20 minutes. I have't owned many headphones before, so I can't compare with others and am not sure if this happens with every headphones, but because of this hurting my ear and head problem, I am not sure if I should use this on the airplane (I have a 13 hour flight to Asia every year).
So, I have to say I would not recommend this headphones to people, but I totally understand the rave reviews for the price.

author: Brent
title: Cheap materials but a great sound
content:
***Update*** Well customer service with this company is unbelievable, I just posted my review a few days ago and never contacted the company and I received a replacement today in the mail. No one ever messaged me or anything about it, just sent a new pair. I have to say I'm impressed and very appreciative. New pair look exactly like the old pair so I assume the plastic will break on these as well but we'll see, maybe they are improved. I'll up my review rating to four stars as a voluntary thank you to the customer service.****

I bought a pair of these back in March 2019, currently September 2019...the cable that came with them has broken inside the coating and no longer works, it is replaceable I suppose. The bigger issue is the plastic headband has cracked in several places and is barely holding together. They've been used daily since new and fairly well cared for, I hang them up when not in use. As far as function, I've been very happy with them, they fit fine and sounded great but I can't bring myself to give them more than a two star rating for cracking out in 6 months. If not for the good fit and sound I'd have given them one star.

author: Reilly Hall
title: So disappointing considering it is CNET highly reviewed.
content:
These headphones would have been excellent especially for the price, I bought my set on a lightning deal for not much more than the cost of a steak lunch.

Except for one thing.

The color and finish of these headphones is admittedly beautiful.  Build quality while not the sturdiest is definitely good enough.  Comfort of the ear muff pads, perfect.  Controls are crisp enough to more or less know what you're doing blind (wearing them).  The battery life appears to be really really good (for as much as I've allowed myself to use them).  Bluetooth range is also very impressive.  Cannot comment on the quality of how I sound to callers when they call me as I don't think I've used them for that purpose yet.

The bad:
Sound quality, what...is...that???  To say they disappoint, is an understatement!  I can't even say they sound flat (little to no bass, as that is not entirely accurate), or dull (low or no treble, there is treble, but it is distorted).  The sound response curve doesn't even sound remotely flat.  There is some bass, but it is strongest around the highest bass frequencies, but then the mids are somewhat flat with the highs a little over pronounced.  It's so bizarre I could not get myself used to the sound quality and had to go back to my cheap pair of $20 Monsters even though they're wired only and I really wanted an equivalent set of Bluetooth headphones to use when wired was not ideal.

I cannot believe I had these in my wish list for months until the lightning deal happened based on a review that had these as the highest reviewed headphones on Amazon.  Only after buying another set of Monster Bluetooth headphones for a similar price did I finally notice the reviews for these that also state poor sound quality.  Also note, I experience the poor sound quality even when wired up!!!  So it's not due to a subpar Bluetooth chipset.  It's either due to cheap or poorly manufactured drivers or some kind of circuitry in between the wired input/Bluetooth output and the drivers that's distorting the sound.

So disappointing, I cannot recommend.

author: C. Squirrel
title: Failed on Arrival -- *** UPDATED ***
content:
*** Updated ***  I received a replacement pair of headphones from the vendor, and will give these 5 stars.  These work great, and I am impressed, yet again, with the quality of Mpow products for a relatively low price.  You get a very good value.  They are not super duper high-fi, but I am happy with them for just listening to music and podcasts at work.

*** Previous Review ***  I was not sure how to rate this, so I guess I will apply it to these specific headphones.  I have bought several Mpow products in the past, and I liked them.  They seem to be well made and well priced and worked out just how I hoped they would.  These headphones looked and felt decent when I received them, and I was excited to use them.  But they would never hold a charge, even after being on the charger for hours.  They worked fine when you used the regular headphone cable, and the Bluetooth worked when plugged in, but once off the charger they would not turn on.  I sent them back immediately but did not get a refund.  But that is another issue, not related to the product itself, and I will detail that in my Seller Review.  I will probably buy Mpow again, and maybe even these headphones, but will definitely check them out thoroughly upon arrival.

author: John F. Jamele
title: Wireless connection to phone lasted two months. Now nothing ...
content:
Wireless connection to phone lasted two months.  Now nothing.  Can still use it with a cord, but that's not why I bought cordless headphones.  And after about six weeks, the signal became very spotty, so I didn't even get two months full use out of them.

UPDATE:  Replacement sent- just another piece of junk which cuts out constantly and requires the use of the cord attachment, rendering them worthless as a replacement for earbuds.  I can imagine that the whole thing will cut out in a few more weeks, just like the first set.  You get what you pay for, I guess.

author: Denise
title: Great quality, but not good for long term wear.
content:
The sound and connectivity of these headphones are great, but I can't wear them for long periods of time.

I have very loud children and there is only so much time I care to spend telling them over and over to quiet down (their favorite thing to do is to jump as loud as possible directly above my office...where their room is...and shake the ceiling above my head, giving me anxiety attacks).  Wouldn't you know it, I don't even have to turn the volume up all the way to completely tune them out.  They get to have fun and I get to not be the miserable parent who does nothing but scream at her children for simply being children.  Unfortunately, I can't wear them on my head too long because they are a snug fit and eventually give me a headache.  I did much better when I first wore them, lasting a few hours at a time, but now I can't wear them but 30-60 minutes before I have to take them off.  It's too bad because I was really happy with them at first.  Maybe they just need to be broken in by resting on top of something a little bit wider than my head for a few days.

The last set of wireless headphones I had had to connect to a base that transmitted the signal.  The base was connected to my computer and that's how they worked.  I had to turn off the sound on my speakers or sound would emanate from both places, defeating the purpose of wearing headphones.  Their range was crap and even when I was sitting directly in front of the base, they would crackle like a bad connection on a radio station.  This was long before Bluetooth and given how poorly those performed and their high cost (at least $80-$100) I wasn't sure what to expect with these.  If not for my head feeling squished so quickly, these would be a five star product, easily.

author: Matthew J. Struthers
title: Downgraded: I would've keep buying and using these...  Three times the right/left speakers no longer work correctly.
content:
I'm downgrading my review of these headphones.

Originally I thought these were great.  They sound, fit, and work as a headset in the greatest I could expect for the price...

BUT

I've seriously kept them folded up and in a case whenever I'm not using 99% of the time!

Three times now, for some reason, only one side works!  When using BlueTooth, only the right side works!  When using the stereo jack/plug, only the left side works!

I'm frustrated because they worked great, then I charged them before folding them and putting them in the case for the night.  On a random morning...

!!!POOF!!!

Only the right side works via BlueTooth.  OR Only the left side works with the wire.

Update on comfort, I've worn these almost 24 hours straight while traveling via Greyhound, playing audio the whole time.  That part is still great.

Original:
Here are the reasons why I bought these:
1. Bluetooth so I can go both hands and wire free to talk and listen to music.
2. Price and audio quality.  Other reviewers indicated the price and quality were great.  I agree!
3. Easy hands-free use.  Being able to adjust the volume and switch tracks without pulling out my phone is great!
4. Headset feature.  I love answering the phone and adjusting the volume without taking the phone out of my pocket or belt holster.
5. Comfort.  I wear these up to 6 hours at a time. They don't get very sweaty or cause discomfort wearing glasses.
6. Wired option.  I like this because if the battery dies (which it hasn't), I can plug them in using a regular audio cable.

They are over the ear and fit really well, even wearing glasses.  With my over the ear hearing aids, they're not as great, but I'll usually take those off just to have these on instead.

This silver pair are actually the 3rd set of this brand that I have had.  My original red pair had a problem after about 9 months of use.  (Perhaps a wire shorted out from folding it or wearing it while lying on a fluffy pillow?)  The second set started to buzz when I was using it in Bluetooth mode, and the audio quality of the microphone became faint.

This time, instead of exchanging them, they refunded the money.  I immediately ordered this pair!

I really recommend buying the hard travel case for these too.  I have always stored my headphones, folded up nicely in the hard case.

author: Harp
title: Great battery and sound, cheaper quality build.
content:
I am sending these back do to a defect in the ear piece, the stitching is coming out, one is gone and the next one is on its way.  The sound was good and the battery life is unbelievable. The quality in material is ok, the ear pieces and padding on the top where they sit on your head being the highest, the buttons felt a bit loose and cheap. They came with a bag to carry them which was nice.

I contacted customer service and sent pictures they request promptly but they hadn't responded, possibly do to time differences, so I decided to save the hassle and return since I was within 30 days of purchase. I decided to go with an ANC set from a different manufacture. If seller had been more prompt I probably would of tried another pair.

Added another 2 stars for over the top customer service. I have received another pair of headphones even though I hadn't requested them. Amazon had also issued my refund. They are not quite on par with the $150 set of Sony I bought locally, but these MPOW 059 are really worth buying at this price.

author: Alison L
title: Annoying blue flashing light. Can’t turn it off.
content: Easy to use and work great. I have one significant complaint. You can’t possibly use these in the dark because of an annoying blue flashing light ever few seconds. Bought these for travel but I’ll have to get a different pair so I don’t disturb people around me. Was so pumped about these all day until I went to bed and discovered the issue. After reading other reviews it seems you can’t turn this off.

author: Diva380
title: 4-Month Old Headphones, Inconsistent Sound in Right Ear
content:
It's been 4 months since I bought these headphones, and the sound in the right ear has recently started going in and out. I have to maneuver the wiring with tape on the left side in order to KEEP the sound in the right ear. My headphones always go out in one ear eventually, but never THIS quickly.

October 2018 EDIT: I was sent another pair for free shortly after posting my initial review, but these too are acting up. If the wire gets moved (whenever I move my head in any direction), it can result in static, the sound coming out in only one ear, or silence. Going to have to purchase a different pair of headphones.

author: Stacey
title: We like them. They are comfortable (after break in)
content:
*** Update ***
After 20 months of use one of our headphones is beginning to flake around the ear pads.  They still work but the earpads are not replaceable.  This is a shame because once broken in the cans are reasonably comfortable, provide good sound reproduction and block out outside noises.  At ~$35.00 a pair we got lots of use out of them and would still recommend them but be aware that once the pads are gone these cans will need replacing.  There are some other budget options with replaceable pads and these might be better for the environment.  Better still MPOW just redesign these to have replaceable ear pads.

My husband and I both have a pair of these headphones.  We like them.  They are comfortable (after they are broken in, they are a bit tight at first) sound good and work as well on Bluetooth as they do plugged into an audio cable.  To our geeky ears they sound good but we are not audiophiles.  The battery lasts a long time when used in Bluetooth mode and they do a relatively good job of blocking background noise.  I compared them with a pair of expensive Bose noise cancelling phones and discovered they couldn't completely block the baby crying behind my airline seat either.  For 10% of the price these do at least 90% of the job.  They may not be the sexiest headphones around but they work well and when we wear them out (one well used pair is already 1.5 years old and still holding up just fine) we would buy again.  We like these cans and would recommend them.

author: Ember
title: Get the insurance! Short term use headphones but 4star customer service
content:
**2nd Update 6/14/2019. Rating changed from 4 stars to 5 stars 6 months after receiving replacement pair. The replacement pair of headphones are still working perfectly. They are in use daily by a special needs child with sensory issues. They are used for multiple hours each day for school work, to play computer & video games, to listen to music, binural sounds and calming meditation music. They are taken on every single outing to be used either for their audio abilities while using electronics while we are out, as an aid for calming when sensory overload kicks in and even worn turned off just for their noise canceling abilities during musical theater, airports, and other noisy, crowded situations. And they are even slept in every single night (turned off) just to help block out noises that may awaken her. They do not fully block all sounds obviously, but they definitely muffle sounds and make it challenging to hear and understand if someone is talking to you or even notice any outside noises. Obviously, with the amount of use they get each day and the way they are used, they clearly hold up beautifully. No special care is taken with them. They are an essential part of daily life in our household and make life a little bit easier, more pleasant and navigable for our special needs child. When they do finally bite the dust, I will be replacing them with the exact same pair from Patozen due to the amazing way they have held up in the extreme usage they receive and for the awesome customer service I received from this company when I initially purchased this model and experienced issues with it. These headphones are worth way more than I paid for them and are priceless for what they've given my child.

*Rating changes from 1 star to 4 stars on December 2nd, 2018 due to excellent customer service actions to rectify unpleasant experience with headphones.**

Purchased the Mpow 059 August 28th, 2018 due to the majority of favorable reviews, it's ability to function wireless and wired, the fact it was over ear and it's moderate pricing. The headphones were being purchased to replace another Mpow model that ceased functioning correctly a few months after purchase before ultimately losing the ability to charge and had to be discarded. I thought perhaps since this 059 model was different and a newer version, it would not have the issues that the previously purchased model had. I was wrong. Within the first month, there was issues with crackling sounds when used wirelessly and sounds cutting out on 1 or both speakers sporadically. Since it was intermittent, it was more of an occasional annoyance in the beginning than anything else. Within 6 weeks of purchase though, the sound quality issues got worse and the ability to charge the headphones with the usb charger provided declined. It was only possible to use the headphones if they were plugged into a laptop with the provided cable. After another 10-14 days, they were not even able to function in that mode.  So within 2 months of purchasing, I was left with headphones that do not function in any capacity and followed along with the same breakdown of problems as the previous model I had purchased, only much quicker after purchase than the 5 months of use I got out of the other pair before their function decline began. I did decide to purchase the offered insurance for this pair after my experience with the previous pair. Unfortunately, due to how quickly after purchase I needed to make a claim, I was informed I needed to contact the manufacturer. I cannot even begin to figure out exactly whom I need contact to replace these considering all the numerous options there are when purchasing these through Amazon, especially taking into account that the manufacturer is based in Hong Kong when I looked up their info online to contact them. I recommend anyone that wants to purchase these, make sure you are aware of the possibility of equipment failure within 6 month's of purchase. And make sure you already know whom to contact and how to contact them when the inevitable occurs or just be fine with putting out $30-$60 for a short term use pair of headphones.

author: Brutus
title: I should have read the low scores before I bought these
content:
1/22/19 UPDATE:. The vendor asked me to review what I believe is the next step up, the H1. This is the review

The H1 is apparently a lighter weight version of the one I originally bought. I still have a problem with these blocking out any ambient sound. If my wife is watching TV, it is irritating to try to listen to streaming music or videos on my computer. She can't hear what I am playing, but I can hear the TV mixed with whatever I'm trying to lister to. The two media sounds clash and turning up the volume only blasts out and hurts my ears. There doesn't appear to be any difference between these two styles, other than the weight.

The sound and comfort are both good. If you are in a quiet room, with no other sounds nearby, they might work for you. If there are sounds from people or other electronics in the room, no matter how quiet, you will still hear it all. The bottom line is neither of these work well for blocking any sound at all. Spend the few extra dollars and get something with noise cancelling technology.

UPDATE: Although they state there is a 45 day money-back guarantee, they are charging a return fee! If you buy these and return return them you will get charged.

These appear to have a good quality sound. However, they block out nothing. I can hear everything in the room, with normal ambient sounds coming through. That's not what I want from headphones. I knew they were not noise cancelling when I bought them, but I did expect them to block some sound.

They look good and are comfortable, just not effective

author: Kae
title: Didn't last 3 months ***update 3/1/19***
content:
update: 3/1/2019

The company reached out to me promptly and sent me a replacement. This one works just fine and I've had no issues with it, and it's been several months since I have received this replacement. Changing one star review to four stars now.

Original 1 star review:

I originally really enjoyed these headphones. I loved that they were made of a (seemingly) sturdy material. I had no issues with sound quality or battery life. At the time, my only issue was that the headphones would blink, and I had no idea why. But it wasn't that much of a nuisance. However, today I look at my headphone and realize that the fabric on the band has nearly completely come off. I only use these headphones for casual listening, typically in my room, and don't use them every single day, so there's no reason for these to have lasted not even 3 months. Waste of money.

author: Brian Lane
title: Great Value, but not as good as Tao Tronics (Model: TT-BH22)
content:
I think there is a threshold where no matter how cheap the product is it isn't worth buying.  I bought a pair of 15$ bluetooth headphones that had 4.5+ star reviews; unfortunately, they are uncomfortable and sound bad to the point I wouldn't want to use them if they were free.  Too many people considered their dirt cheap price and inflated the review as a result, making it hard to discern quality difference between different priced headphones (considering prices are vastly different when people buy, using price as a main criteria for review is a bad way of reviewing because I have no way to know what you paid and the value you place on a dollar)

These get 3.5 stars based mostly on quality and not price (5 stars for value since they hit the minimum threshold of quality imo to be used daily).  I got these to be my backup headphones for work since I hate bringing my main pair back and forth.  Comparing these to the TaoTronics, they definitely dont have the same quality of sound, nor are the ear pads as soft and pillow like.  I do like the button setup on the right earpiece better though.  The charge time is only 20 hours vs 30 (advertised), but I never had run out of juice using either, so both are long enough for me.  The TaoTronics have a slightly less bulky profile and less "creaky" plastic as well.  At ~50$ the TaoTronics would be my purchase every time (I got these on sale for 26$) because even at "double" the price, it ends up being only 25 real dollars, which is a small amount considering the amount I listen to music and that they should last a few years.

In the end, these have solid comfort (true over the ear as stated), decent enough sound to not be noticeable in a bad way and link to my phone every time.  I even like how it tells you when you turn it on what phone its linked to (Phone 1 or Phone 2).

This is a true review on quality without considering price; 3.5 stars. You cant do half stars so the tie breaker is where the value comes in to bump up to a 4

author: Eric
title: Favorite headphones, BUT...
content:
These are the best headphones I've probably ever had. And I've had MANY pairs of different style headphones over the years.

I've used these every day for the last few months since I bought them and can genuine say that they work extremely well. The sound quality is very good, noise cancelling works very well as long as the volume is at the appropriate level and the battery on these lasts forever. The Bluetooth function is my favorite. I HATE cords.

My ONLY con with these headphones is that my set is starting to break where the headstrap meets the silver metal piece just above the headphones. On both sides too. Its a little upsetting just because of how much I love these headphones but on the other hand they were only $27. If these were $80 headphones I'd be pissed but considering how cheap they are I can forgive them for this one flaw.

Overall - 9/10

author: Highcountryrider
title: Disappointed with audio quality
content:
These are the first Bluetooth over the ear headphones I have purchased so I don't have a basis for comparison with other brands or models. The price was good and the fit was fine for me. Wearing comfort was OK but I haven't worn them for an extended period of time due to my issue with the audio quality (below).

Pairing was simple with  my smartphone. Operation with the buttons took a little getting used to but worked fine. I haven't used them enough to comment on battery life.

My major complaint with these headphones is the quality of the sound. The audio was just dull sounding to me. Mids and highs were poor and almost sounded muffled. Bass was only OK. I played the same music with a set of recently purchased MPow Bluetooth earbuds and there was no comparison. The earbuds audio was bright and realistic even though they cost about 1/2 the price of the over the ear headphones.

Edit 10/10/2017: My original review should have included the comment that for me the major complaint about the audio quality of these headphones is that vocals are coming through sounding muffled or dull and also seem to be at a lower level than the instrumentals on any track I listen to. Instrumental only tracks sound OK.

I unfortunately have just missed my 45 day money back return option so I'm stuck with them. I just know I would not purchase this item again or recommend them to others.

Mpow Bluetooth Headphones Over Ear, Hi-Fi Stereo Wireless Headset, Foldable, Soft Memory-Protein Earmuffs, w/ Built-in Mic and Wired Mode for PC/ Cell Phones/ TV

author: J.W. Henry
title: Quality Headphones. Almost Perfect.
content: The Mpow 059 Bluetooth Headphones are obviously made of quality materials. The sound is excellent, bass is great, light weight, with comfortable ear pads. The wireless bluetooth operation, so far, has been error free. They quickly pair up with my Dell desktop, my iPhone and my iPad without any problem. But here are a few other observations: if your desktop computer does not have built in bluetooth, then you will have to purchase a separate "dongle" to make the connection. I didn't know this at the time I ordered the phones, so it took a couple more days to get the Plugable Technologies adaptor ($12.49). Also, there is no charger included with the phones. You will have to use the included USB connection cord that plugs into your desktop computer and the other end (which is tiny) plugs into the bottom of one of the ear phones. Charging via USB takes a couple of hours for a full charge, but the charge lasts for 20 hours or so. The only issue I have with the phones is that they are so tight against my head/ears that I can only wear them for  an hour before I have to take them off because my ears are killing me! And I have a narrow head. I have tried to stretch them several different ways, but nothing has worked yet. I may have to return these if I can't find a solution.

author: D. Flink
title: If you’re a parent, you NEED these
content: I’m a mother to a teenager and 2 littles 2.5 and 11 months. Sometimes I need to hand them over to another adult and not hear them. I had been eyeing a pair of Bose headphones but let’s face it, with 3 kids Bose headphones aren’t in my budget. These are an amazing value and I’ve recommended them to all of my friends. These make it possible to snuggle and comfort a crying baby without having to listen to the crying for 11 straight hours. I never would have made it through the colic days (and nights) without these.

author: Undercover J
title: Good set of headphones!
content:
Update 3/8/18

For my initial review, I've rated these headphones 2/5. But now I'm updating my review and rating to 4/5 and heres why. I was contacted by Patozon company and they were concerned about my issues and wanted to make it a better experience for me. They sent over the new headphone replacement without extra cost. They arrived quickly then anticipated. Right out the box the replacements looked a lot better then the first pair. The build quality was nice and the hinges seemed to be better then the first pair. As for the fit, I wear glasses all the time. But I was still able to get a nice seal around the ears and block the noises around me. As for the sound quality, they still struggle just a bit. But with my iPhone, I'm able to change the settings for the music and get something more desirable. Another great feature I like, is the battery status. on the iPhone, it displays how much charge is left on the headset. Not every headphones offer that feature. Overall this was a better headset then I thought. I also have to commend Patozon for their great customer service. They were patient and helpful and solved my issues swiftly.

Thank you,

Old review:
They are a mediocre pair of headphones. They do the simple job of playing music.  The build quality is rather decent. But just like every other headphones, the area that should concern is the hinges. Not sure how they'll hold during time. For the price you get something just ok, just don't expect those high end features here.

author: C. Dees
title: Cant Get Much Better at this Price Point
content:
If you are looking a these Mpow 059 headphones, let's be honest... you probably are more interested in the price than the quality, but to be honest, these are pretty darn solid.

The sound range is much better than I would have expected, with clear peaks and a broad range for the bass drivers. I use these every week when editing videos for my YouTube channel, because they are better than several other Budget gaming headphones I've tried.

These are wireless headphones, which can be charged via USB, but you can also use them as wired headphones. So, if you dont want to use them wirelessly, there is no need to charge them. A single charge lasts for a good while. I've used them on long flights as well, and if I had to guess, on average, they last for about 8 hours of use before needing another charge.

There is no noise cancelling, but the pads on the ear cups are soft and mold well enough to the ears to dampen a good amount of external noise.

author: Eric R. Shaver
title: Amazing cans for the price
content:
Battery life: A+
Comfort: A+
Sound Quality: B
Pairing Process: A+
Durability: A+
Connectivity:A+

Batterylife:
Holy smokes, this thing will go and go like your typical energizer bunny.

Comfort:
I've never found myself wanting to take these off simply because they hurt my ears or head. Very comfortable.

Sound Quality:
This is where you get what you pay for. They're your standard cheap can's sound quality. They don't touch Etymotic, Shure, or Klipsh, but they're not awful. I can admire music from nearly every speaker I hear it out of. The average person won't have an issue with the SQL.

Pairing Process:
I know this is important to a lot of you. The pairing process was very easy with my iPhone X, and my Macbook Pro 15" (Late 2016). The caveat here, is how MPow allows two connected devices at the same time. There have been times I've turned these on 50 feet away from my computer, expecting them to pair to my phone, only to have forgotten they were last connected to my computer. Wouldn't you know, these headphones connected to the computer. They stuttered a bit (50 feet was also through concrete walls...), but the connectivity distance is surprising on these. Make sure you only keep one thing paired to them at a time though.

Durability:
I list durability because I work in the construction industry, so everything is subject to destruction. These headphones have held up to the tough environment I thrust them through.

Connectivity:
I already elaborated on the 50 feet range. Surprisingly strong connectivity.

author: Ski
title: love them so far
content: I've only had these for an afternoon but I already love them. I have a large head and certain headphones pressing into my ears or scalp cause migraines. So far, these have felt very comfortable and the sound quality is excellent. I was able to easily pair them with my Nexus 5. I'm still figuring out how to pair them with my Asus Chromebook. They are circumaural (cover the ear completely) and build quality seems good for the price.  I bought these to replace a pair of wireless sennheiser RD160s that stopped working. I will update this review if these give me trouble after I get more use out of them but I am already impressed with them, given the price.

author: Gottfried Mind
title: One Hour Out of the Box Quick Review - All is Well with these headphones.
content:
I ordered these headphones from Amazon Prime yesterday after reading a review on the website BGR.com.  They had a $7.00 discount code  for the already low price of $34.99.  (The discount code was very popular, and has now expired. You won’t miss that $7 if you order these for the normal price, though.)

With so many positive reviews, I figured it was a no-brainer, especially with $7 off an already low price.

I got one day delivery - They were waiting when I got home tonight.  Quick set-up.  Had them connected to my phone in a minute.  Included in the packaging is a USB charging cable, a mini jack for corded connection to another device, a tiny little start-up guide and and nice little storage bag.  These headphones fold up for storage and claim a battery life of 20 hours.  They also have a built-in microphone for taking phone calls.  I haven’t tried the mic yet.

I’ll be keeping these.  I will keep the box and packaging until I can’t return them if there is a quality issue.

I listen to a lot of country, and I am really, really happy with the sound on the stuff I’ve listened to so far.  Mid range is a little scooped, but, oh well.....
I spent $30 for some great headphones for my intended use.
I have some more expensive headphones - they cost a lot more - but they’re not bluetooth, and I’m not taking them out side, which is where the MPOW’s I just got today will be.

I plan on using these while I’m out in the yard mowing.  Maybe for watching TV without waking her up....

Score - 5 Thumbs Up

author: G. Larson
title: Maybe can't use them in a quiet office - otherwise GREAT BUY!
content:
I only have one negative thing to say about this product. They leak a lot of sound, so if you work in a quiet office and want to play music loudly through these headphones, other people will be able to hear it. This is not the case with more expensive (*much* more expensive) headphones.

The voice prompts that tell you what you're doing ("Power on", "Phone 1 connected", "Phone 2 connected" etc.) are really nice, but can be different in the power-off sequence depending on which devices are connected. This is a *tad* confusing, and sometimes, depending on what devices are connected, the power-off sequence doesn't end with the typical, very useful "Power Off" voice output.

Other than that, these earn every bit of 5 stars for the price. As others say, the battery life is very good. It re-connects instantly with my phone and quickly after that with my laptop every time I turn the headphones on. Moving from wired headphones to these has been a really nice move. These have been totally worth the $35.

There are lots of thoughtful conveniences to these headphones: comes with a wire for wired listening; folding design; has its own volume switch, allowing you to bump up volumes when necessary; connects to multiple devices simultaneously.

The sound quality isn't incredible but it is good enough. I will say this: if the sound quality is bad enough on whatever device I'm listening, I do not enjoy listening to music. These are plenty good enough quality to be enjoyable (for me).

author: Cody R. Kraski
title: BANG FOR A BUCK!!
content:
I usually dont go out of my way to write reviews... these headphones deserve the attention:

I was on the lookout for a decent pair of wireless headphones for working out/running. These are AMAZING. Sound quality is surprisingly great for the price. They're better than most of my wired phones. I'm sure there are better options out there with a bigger price tag, but this is the best for what you're paying.

Design is sleek, durable, and a good weight (not cheap and light, but also not too heavy for comfort). Great fit, snug on the ears, definitely sound cancelling when audio is coming through. Little bulkier, but that's expected with this style. If you want slim, go with something else. But these are very comfortable.

Setup is VERY simple. One button to pair with phone, phone picked up the bluetooth signal within seconds.

Have NOT tested track skip options, or phone call navigation. I dont plan on using this to answer calls anyway. I'll update if I ever do.

PERFECT for what I needed: wireless, high quality sound for my activities.

I highly recommend giving these a shot, you will NOT be disappointed.

author: Shely
title: For the price, it does the job
content:
Update:customer service contacted me quickly about the head phones. They send new ones, but it was a different model (one that was cheaper than these). I tried them but they were too tight on the grip, had to take them out after several hours. I also wear glasses and it’s really uncomfortable with them on, but I need them to read. I’m not saying these headphones (mpow 059) are bad, but they don’t fit my needs which is active nose cancelling. Battery life is great, but padding started to crack in less than two years, so that’s a big con :(( Other than that they’re great for the price. Also, would’ve appreciated a sturdier packaging, the light bag that comes with these headphones broke easily.
*********************************************************

I study medicine and so noise cancelling and good audio are important for me. Description says it's noise cancelling passively, so feature is not really included. I read there is an upgrade to these head phones that does indeed do noise cancelling, so I would suggest getting those. I just put music or white noise to do the noise cancelling.

I would have to say I don't love that it only connects to 2 devices, would've wanted more. Battery life is good, lasts long time (and I study pretty much all day). Sound quality is alright, still think it could be louder and clearer when plugged in with the cable.

I've had them for a little over a year and they still work perfectly.

author: Mandryke
title: like you'd expect from almost any very cheap cans
content:
I'm starting to suspect that virtually all Bluetooth headphone / earbud products in existence have flat frequency response, too much bass, and muddy highs. These cans certainly aren't doing anything to convince me otherwise. Passive noise isolation is almost nonexistent, like you'd expect from almost any very cheap cans; with the sound off, I can can run my fingernails lightly over the wall behind me and still hear it quite clearly. Total noise attenuation might be 4dB; possibly less.

The two high points so far are:
* Relatively lightweight
* Still comfortable after an hour

I'm worried about the folding mechanism; I'm not certain just how many times I can fold these before something snaps off. At least all(?) the moving parts appear to be some kind of light to medium steel, instead of more plastic.

I got these as very inexpensive, relatively acceptable headphones that wouldn't make me worry too much about theft or loss. I think they'll fill that niche, but that's as far as they go.

author: SMART SHOPPER
title: DECENT HEADPHONES, I LIKE THEM A LOT
content: These hold a charge for several hours and charge easily on the included USB cable, and are easy enough to use. I bought these for myself to use with my Surface Pro 4 laptop-tablet combo. I use the headphones via blue tooth when my husband is watching something I don't want to watch on TV while sitting next to me. At times I'd rather put headphones on use my computer rather than watch tv, so the headphones allow me to do that without the sound from my computer interrupting my husbands TV show, or his TV show drowning out my computer. I'm very happy with these now I can listen to my computer in peace & the sound quality is decent. The red color matches my Surface Pro 4  red  detachable key board. The only 'con' for me is that the other included cable has a round shaped end & doesn't attach to any  external  ports on my Surface Pro 4. I believe that cable is more designed for use with a smart phone.  The cable is supposed to attach the headphones directly to your  device for when the batteries run out & blue tooth is not an option. I am going to look into getting some type of adaptor for the cable, if something like that exists. Regardless of that, I still really like these headphones and I hope they will last me a long time.

author: Tim Rossi
title: No real bass, still no real problem! Good headphones!
content:
Ordered these headphones just a few days ago, and came in a bit earlier than expected.

Based on what others have said (mostly the 3 star and below reviews), these were supposed to break within days/are supposed to be uncomfortable/have a bad mic/lousy sound, etc. I haven't experienced any of these issues.

Sure, they don't have a really deep bass, but the sound quality is pretty good. I don't hear any static or the like, it doesn't sound any different than my gaming USB headset; overall, I don't have any complaints whatsoever about the sound, other than the bass. That, however, was easily overlooked as everything else was fine.

I've also read of some battery life complaints. So far, I haven't had any issues with that either. I recharged the batteries the night my headphones came in and hadn't charged them since, using the bluetooth mode for over 7 hours. I'd say that's WAY more than decent. There's always the aux cord they came with if the batteries did die, which I was FULLY expecting to use 100% of the time, but I never needed to use the cord. Not yet anyway.

I haven't tested it with a phone call, but I did use them for a Discord chat when my mic broke. I was actually surprised to have a mic. According to my friends, they mic wasn't that great and the sound from the call was worse, so I CAN'T recommend these headphones for any phone calls. However, I DO use them for music on my phone, as I said via bluetooth, and it paired up just fine.

They definitely are the most comfortable pair I've had, next to my USB gaming headset, and they fit over my ears nicely. Kept my ears warm in cold weather too! I just don't know for sure if sound leaks out or not. I haven't had an opportunity where it would matter, but I would assume the sound doesn't leak out, provided you keep your headset AND your device at a decent volume (you read that right, the headphones keep their own volume as well. Pretty nifty!)

Some reviews say they stop working after a few days, up to maybe a few months. I've only had mine for a few days and they still seem to work as intended. Then again, I'm not too worried as long as I have the cord it came with. If anything, I would say just be careful with them like you would with a PS4, a TV, a computer, your phone, or the like. Don't misuse your equipment and it won't break right away. Not to say other customers are too rough, more-so just fold them carefully and whatnot.

So yeah, other than the lack of a real bass-feel with these headphones, I really like them and I'm glad I made the investment!

author: mouzclik
title: After two years, no complaints!
content:
For the price, these are great. After over a week of around 1.5 hrs a day of gym/run time at near max volume, the headphones still hold a little over half of their charge. Pairing was a breeze, all buttons work just fine, and sound is pretty clear. Bass is great, treble is a little too sharp for rock/metal but that can be remedied through on a music player app. Will update in a couple months.

Update 1, a month later: I just experienced my first low battery beeps after over a month of the initial charge. I can’t really compare to higher end dre beats or bose, but the battery longevity for the price is outstanding.

Update 2, almost 2 years later (08/14/2019): this thing still goes strong after 1 charge and 6 days a week of usage at the gym (about 1-1.5hrs per day)! Amazing for travel. The only degradation that can be observed is from the fake leather on the ear pads which are starting to flake. This issue can be expected for the price you pay, long term fit/finish issues are standard at this price...I maintain my 5 star rating all the way for this price!!!

author: Alisha
title: Excellent customer service! If you have a smaller head you may want to keep looking.
content:
Update: After my review the seller contacted me and offered to send me a replacement pair. They sent me the MPOW Flame headphones. After over six months of using the new headphones I cannot say enough good things about them and I am back to buy a second pair of Flame headphones for my husband. Great customer service!

I read a ton of reviews before buying this product and I was super excited to love them and use them daily. However, I ran into a bit of a snag...
First, all of the things I love about the Mpow 059:
 - They sync with my devices very quickly. (quicker than my $300 headphones)
 - I love that they talk to me and tell me what commands I have given. (e.g. Push the power button and it will tell you "powering on" or if your headphones are already on it says "pairing" "phone one paired")
 - I love that I can feel the volume  and track forward and back buttons easily
 - I love the ear padding, it feels good on your ears as opposed to the cheap snap-crackle-pop you get with some of the other ear covers out there.

Now for where things went wrong for me.
 - The reviews I read mentioned a long charging cord one even showed a 4 ft cord in the review video. My charging chord was a little over a foot and a half. Not a huge deal but certainly not helpful when I want to charge my headphones while wearing them in bed.
 - The biggest challenge with these headphones was size. I had the headphones set at the smallest setting and there was no tension to keep them on my ears so the band across the top of the earphones put a painful amount of pressure on the top of my head. I wore them for a couple of days, adjusting the band on top of my head forward or back to try and alleviate the pain but no luck.
I love so much about these headphones, I wish they worked for me but I just can't take head pain.

I hesitate sending them back, I'm not sure I want to deal with the hassle so I may just donate them to some lucky person (with a larger head).
Just be warned, if you have a smaller head you may want to keep looking. Insert sad face here.

author: CuznJay
title: A Fantastic Value, but Not Without Small Downsides
content: This is my first pair of Bluetooth headphones though I have a small collection of standard headphones ranging from budget-friendly to expensive options. Having said that, the sound on the Mpow 059 headphones are acceptable, but while they're fairly clear they don't offer an audiophile-level of sound reproduction. This, however, is really not the reason to own Bluetooth headphones. These connect easily to my Apple laptop at work, and, if I use the included software, they work well on my Windows 10 PC at home. Using Windows' default Bluetooth settings, I suffered audio quality loss and difficulty connecting and reconnecting. These are great for the money, they're comfortable to wear (and I have a large head), and they offer every convenience I wanted when purchasing wireless headphones. I recommend these for people wanting portability, cord-free convenience, and decent sound quality.

author: starkanthonye
title: Pretty good, Recommended
content:
UPDATE: YOU CANT USE THIS WITH ANY APP OTHER THAN THE PHONE, MUSIC, OR YOUTUBE APP. AAAAA.

The microphone is apparently pretty good. The sound quality is really good...unless you take a call, and then switch back to music. Then you get the call quality for the music, which isnt so hot.
They fit really well. I didnt have to adjust or anything. Then again, I've got a small head. And ears.
The buttons are kinda...odd? Like, one button does four or five different things. But I guess that's better than ten tiny buttons.
I plan on using these for live streaming, so I'll keep yall updated on how well they hold up. And maybe gaming.

author: Gabby Hart
title: Listening to them now!
content:
I'm using these headphones as I write this review. (Currently listening to Don't Want to Miss a Thing by Aerosmith)
I am extremely impressed with the quality of these headphones for the price. I was a little bit leery of going with an unknown brand of headphone, but I am pleasantly surprised.
I am in no way a headphone connoisseur, and keep in mind my ears are not as attune as others when it comes to quality, bass, treble, etc. but as for me, just wanting to listen to my music; they're perfect! Not sure how long the battery last yet as I'm still on my first charge, but I'm sure they'll last me the day at school and gym.
As for the comfort, it's probably as comfortable as you can expect headphones to be. They fit over my ears pretty well, and are adjustable depending on how large your head is. They also fold up and come with a aux cord in case the battery dies. Would purchase these a million times over, and would recommend to those who are looking for a good pair for a good price!
(No, I did not get these at a discounted price in exchange for an honest review -- I just like helping people make decisions!)

P.S. Volume controls on the right side are super easy to navigate.

author: brian woolf
title: For the price you absolutely cannot best these headphones
content:
For the price you absolutely cannot best these headphones. I ordered these for my wife to use during a trip from DFW to SEATAC and nearly didn't give them to her because I liked them so much.

Pairing is quick and simple just press and hold the power button and you are good to go.

Sound quality will blow you away considering what you paid for these, I've bought many headphones in my life some very expensive and some very cheap, these sound like they should cost about $120 the bass isn't amazing but that'd alright with me.

Passive noise cancelation is nothing like active noise cancelation, all these do is isolate you from the outside world and as such anything too high pitched or too low pitched will still make it through. But once the music is playing you won't be able to hear the outside world at all.

Battery life has been outstanding so far as well I haven't actually managed to fully kill them yet but they did last from the moment I got through security st the airport to when I stepped into my ride at the other side a good 10 hours later.

My only real problem is the fact that instead of just a beep when at full volume it actually has a voice telling you that and it can be a bit annoying.

author: Leslie Goodwin Ross
title: Great headphones, great price
content:
I was waiting to post my review until I had used them multiple times a day for about a week.
I've used them for several different reasons. I've worked out with them, used them for meditation music during the day sitting up, nature sounds for falling asleep laying down and listening to music while cleaning the house. These have been AMAZING. The sound is really good for the price paid for them, the fit is comfortable..even when laying down, the charge lasts a long time. I charged them fully when I received them. I listened to them at least 4-5 hours a day for almost 5 days before I needed to charge them again. Range is great. I can leave my phone on charge & walk around or I can hook up to my tv or sound bar and be hands-free. The folding design is awesome. Construction is not fragile.
I let my husband use them and we've decided these red and black ones will be his and I'm going to order the pink ones.
If you're looking for a good set of headphones for a decent price then I'd definitely recommend these.

author: Elizabeth Sclafani
title: Better than I thought it was gonna be tbh
content: Okay so I was a bit worried in spite of the massive amount of amazing reviews these have received but thankfully I didn’t allow myself to be deterred from purchasing these. I just got these today and I was testing them out in the various ranges and generas of music since I literally listen to everything from rock to pop to Latin (cumbia, banda,regatón, etc) to country to edm and many more. So I was trying it out on Bluetooth and at first it sounded a little low to me so I tried putting my phone volume as loud as I could and the sound was “okay” and I thought the bass was a little weak and the treble as passable. Then I started messing with the controls and that’s when I tried messing with the volume and suddenly the volume started to rise even though my phone volume was on “max”. In other words the volume on your phone is separate from the headphone!!! And it COMPLETELY changed the sound!!! For the price these headphones blow the same price range skullcandy’s out of the water!!! The only thing I have yet to test is if other people can hear my music as I am playing it but I can’t hear anything. Also I haven’t tested the mic feature. If anything changes I will amend this.

author: Triq Melita
title: Update: Company  replaced!!! formerly:'They lose their pairing every time i turn them off'
content:
Update: January 31, 2019 - The Mpow company, on its own volition, sent me a new pair of these headphones. I was pleasantly surprised to a) receive them and b) find out that this pair actually works. They asked me to update this review. I am doing it because there are reasons for it: a) I appreciate that they paid attention to my review and understood that the issue is not trivial, and b) because I am hoping to save others from having this issue in the future, and possibly, hope the company will include instructions of the sort that follow with the headphones.

How to keep the pairing: After the headphones are paired once, they should be able to keep their pairing with whatever device. The actual pairing 'code' is kept with the pairing device (phone, computer, TaoTronics transmitter), but the 'beaming' signal comes from the device to be paired (headphones). In my case, apparently one of the two headphone sets I had bought lost its ability to have its 'beaming' signal understood by the device I needed it paired with.

After trying various ways I found that it is important to turn the headphones on FIRST, *before* turning on the Bluetooth function or the device I want to pair the headphones with. After turning on the device or its Bluetooth function, I, then, lightly tap once the headphone's on/off button to 'jumpstart' their sending their signals to pair. Pairing with the device comes very soon after that.

To preserve the pairing 'code' in the device's memory and make sure I don't need to go through 'pairing' the next time I need, I reverse the order of turning things off. First I turn off the device (turn off the Bluetooth on the phone or computer or turn off the device) and after this is off, I press the headphones button long enough to turn them off to prolong the battery charge.

I use these headphones regularly with the TeoTronics Bluetooth Transmitter to connect two headphones to the same phone. The TaoTronic BT Transmitter is a goodie that adds Bluetooth functionality where absent (old cassette player, old LP player, etc) and allows you to pair to it two sets of headphones simultaneously. Both are important functions to me. I can listen to my old cassettes & LPs using the BT headphones, and two of us can watch the same show on TV/computer with headphones at the same time. This is invaluable for anyone hard of hearing.

Would I buy the headphones again? I already did. I liked their sound so much that I bought a second pair. So, yes, I do recommend them.

And, BTW, they worked very well on a plane. We connected two pairs to one phone (see method above) and played our music throughout the flight without interruptions when we needed to get up and walk! Perfect setup!
=================================
old(er) review:

I bought two of these pairs because they sound good. But they are a pain because they lose their pairing EVERY TIME. I sent a message to the company for another pair I bought and ended up returning after waiting for a response that was too late too little...

You have to keep pressing the button to turn them on or off. But while doing that they also go into pairing mode and ... forget to pair.  I am quite ticked off and needless to say, dissatisfied with the purchase.  So much so, that I found something totally unrelated made by 'mpow' and walked away. (January 31, 2019: I will consider other items made by Mpow now).

author: Susanna
title: Not noise-canceling, but stellar customer service!!
content:
Bought for the noise-cancelling, which it doesn’t do. Otherwise... good headphones - satisfactory sound quality and excellent battery life. They were also fairly loose on my head, so I didn’t feel like I got headaches from wearing them. However, I had a lot of trouble getting the power/play/pause/call button to do exactly what I wanted. I probably just couldn’t figure out what area to press the button. And the case they come in isn’t hard, so I was always a little worried that I’d break them.

Customer service reached out to me, and I now have replacement headphones, Mpow H8 model, which are amazingly spectacular! The sound quality is excellent. They have active noise canceling (ANC), which is marvelous, and can be turned on/off. It does have an uncomfortable sound when you just have your headphones on with the ANC on, and no music. But, I imagine, if you buy these, it’s with the intention of listening to music/voices. The buttons are small enough to where you don’t have to hit a certain spot to play/pause. The ... ear covers (?) are more flexible than the Mpow 059, which makes it easier to have one ear uncovered (because sometimes that’s a necessary situation). The H8 fit a *little* more snug than the 059, which means I can push them back a little farther on my head, and not worry about them slipping off. Last, but not least, the Mpow H8 come with a hard case. I haven’t had them long enough to comment on the battery life, but I expect, with the 059 battery life being long, these may also perform at the same level.  https://www.amazon.com/Mpow-Cancelling-Bluetooth-Headphones-Wireless/dp/B076W29YZS/ref=mp_s_a_1_fkmrnull_8?keywords=mpow+h8&qid=1552138056&s=gateway&sr=8-8-fkmrnull

author: It's Lolo
title: Good and bad...
content: I purchased these headphones at the beginning of October and absolutely loved them.  They sound awesome and they're pretty good at blocking out background noise. The bluetooth connection has been a little iffy since I got them so I have just went to using the aux cable cord when this happens.  Used the bluetooth just fine for the last couple of days with no issues until I decided to charge it this morning since it was not connecting or reacting to pushing buttons.  The red light did not come on (will turn on when charging) and the side where you plug it in to charge got really hot.  Trying to find any kind of online support from MPOW is impossible and now my 'wireless' headphones are back to being plain old plug-in headphones.  They still sound awesome, but now I have to buy a longer aux cord so I can do work at my computer without having to sit so close to the screen.  Time to find a different pair of wireless headphones. :-/

author: Zyzzogeton
title: not bad. But certainly not great
content:
Just charged these up and paired with my headphones.  First impression: not bad.  But certainly not great.  Fit seems decent, but then again I've only had them on for 15 minutes so far.  Sound seems muffled, especially at low volume.  Keeping phone volume high and lowering volume on headphone seems a little better than the other way around.  Also seems better when I remind myself I only paid $34 for these, and my primary use will be for workouts at the gym or on my bike trainer.  If you're after good music quality, spend more $.  If your primary use will be listening to the music you love, spend a LOT more $$.  These will spend a lot of time banging around in my gym bag and just generally being abused.  For my intended use these should work well.
Update - 3 days later:  Muffed sound continues to bother me.  These sound better at higher volumes, but I like to listen quietly.  Not a great experience with these.  i think they're going to go back.

author: Jennsen
title: A decent pair of headphones
content:
EDIT: I gave this product an extra star because of amazing customer service! They read my review and sent me out a different pair of headphones, and the new ones are AMAZING! I am incredibly impressed that they went out of their way to make the customer happy.

Also, while I am still not a fan of this particular model, my boyfriend loves them. He says they are comfortable for him to wear and he really likes the bass. We will definitely be coming to this company and seller for any future headphone needs.
... End edit...

While the battery life is great, they seem to be made pretty well, and the Bluetooth range is good, they are way too tight! My ears were so sore after about 10 minutes!
And I know that one of the selling points great bass (which is why I chose these) but the rest of the audio sounds muffled, almost like I am listening through a tin can.
Not to mention that if the volume goes anywhere over half way, ALL the sound leaks out. No privacy here, I might as well be wearing a speaker attached to my head!
For such a popular, highly rated pair of headphones, I am very disappointed. Apparently I was not the target for this product. :(

author: Denver Terry
title: I am loving these headphones!!
content:
I'm rough on my gear. As such I wasn't about to spend a ton of money on headphones that I'm likely to beat to death with use. I relied on the Amazon customer reviews to find an inexpensive set of headphones with high ratings and lower price. I found the reviews for this model to be the most consistent so I took the chance and bought a set.

When they arrived I plugged them in to charge and was pleasantly surprised to see that they fully charged in about 4 hours. The next task was pairing the headphones with my cell phone. Typically this is the most frustrating part of blue-tooth technology but I was again pleasantly surprised that the pairing was simple and fast. Once paired I started testing the sound and volume and again, couldn't be happier. Sounds good and has enough bass to make rap sound good. Phone calls are surprisingly clear for both parties as well. I was concerned that the lack of microphone near my mouth would be an issue for the other party but no complaints so far. The headphones are very comfortable and the controls are easy to use. I like the ability to adjust volume, skip or go back to a song, and pause from the controls on the headphones. The cable to direct connect to an audio jack is great. I will likely forget to charge the headphones at some point but I won't be dead in the water without music!

author: Jennifer Hertzig
title: Perfect price and quality
content: Got these for my 13 year old who listens to music constantly. They are great sound and they block out the annoying sounds from his younger brother so he can enjoy his music. They fold up nice for going in his book ag while at school.

author: Mystery Shopper
title: OMB do I love this Bluetooth stuff!
content: These headphones and the TaoTrobnics 20m Transmitter came yesterday (delivered on Sunday!), and do I ever love it. I did my dishes the morning listening to Peter Hill playing the Bach English Suite and it's a very big deal for me because I live in a condo with not much sound insulation, and I haven't dared do that for the last 8 years! It took some fussing around to get the transmitter and the headphones to find one another and get hitched, so to speak. But the next time I used them they were old friends. I love it, love it.
